text: I went to this Crispy Crepe for breakfast on the 4th of July. It's a cute and quaint restaurant. You have the option to sit inside or out. I ordered the egg and veggie omelette that was nothing but amazing! My side of fruit (melon and pineapples) was freshly cut and delicious. The crepe is huge so come hungry. Parking is easy. There's a free parking garage behind the building or you can park on the street. This is definitely a new favorite spot for me. I will be back soon.

Got a tasty several cheese (3 maybe?) crepe. Will definitely be going back for a sweet one sometime. Service was good and pretty quick. Worth the price of admission in my book, especially considering the prices were relatively cheap.

Disappointed in the menu options here and the texture of the crepes. In terms of savory crepes, there aren't many options and the combinations just aren't appetizing. Hazelnuts uptown is hands down better for options, taste, crepe texture and also about $2 a crepe cheaper.

They really close whenever they want to. Came here 20 minutes before close and they told us they are not open. Even tried calling before arriving but they didn't even pick up. I'm here from California so really sad and disappointed that I couldn't even try this place. Heard good things but hey I'll never know now.

I had a friend in town who loves crepes, so we gave Crispy Crepes a try. The restaurant was cozy and quaint. The service was wonderful. We both split an asparagus/Caesar salad, savory cheese crepe, and sweet peanut butter/chocolate crepe. We each also ordered one of their special lattes. Everything was delicious. We were stuffed and happy for the rest of the day!

We've had the sweet, we've had the savory and I'm not sure which was more delightful.  Great flavors, rich and wonderful.... Can't wait to experience more of the great offerings from this JEM! And to boot, they serve Coca-Cola!  A match made in heaven!  We will most definitely be back!

If you are visiting or passing through (or no where near) South End - make some extra time in your schedule to visit this place! And make sure to ask for the amazing Sophia! She was a fantastic server

Was nervous to go here based on some yelp reviews but I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Went for brunch on A Saturday morning and was seated immediately outside in the beautiful weather. The waitress implied that the sweet crepes were not large enough to be a full meal, but I was pleasantly supposed at how big my maple crush cheesecake crepe was. It Totally filled me up. There was definitely too much maple cream filling but everything else was perfect. It even came with a chocolate covered strawberry and dollop of whipped cream. My friend got the bruschetta crepe and seemed equally pleased with her choice. Service was superb and we were taken care of very well. The prices seem a little steep, esp for the sweet crepes that don't have any meat in them, so I took off one star, but I am already craving another crepe and will definitely be back. It also looks like they do call ahead and pick up as I saw one girl walk up with her dog and hand her credit card to a server outside who then returned with a to go bag for her. Being within walking distance to all the southend apts is a plus.

Mixed experience at best - I debated giving two stars. I don't plan on returning.

Pros: My gluten-free buckwheat crepe was quite tasty and the filling had fresh, properly cooked ingredients. Even eggs were perfectly done and the arugula was unbruised. When I needed help, the manager was great.

Cons: Sides were meh. The au gratin that my husband had apparently tasted like it came from a frozen foods section, not a restaurant.

However, service was the real problem.

1) Weeks before eating here, I walked in to discuss gluten-free options when I happened to be in the area. I was told that they do gluten-free orders frequently (as you'd expect since they carry a gluten-free crepe batter) and was told that they can make anything on the menu without gluten! This sounded too good to be true but the hostess insisted that this was the case. Of course, it isn't true, and I have no idea why she said so.

2) When I visited, they nearly gave up our table because they couldn't find us when it was ready. Where were we? Sitting in the waiting chairs right in front of them! Thank goodness one of our party went up to check up on them. Again, I have no idea why this happened.

3) The waitress had a remarkable amount of trouble understanding my gluten-free order. I'd ask a question about whether an item was gluten-free, and she'd respond by saying something about the item that had nothing to do with whether it contains gluten. This went on for several menu items until she started to say something about how they didn't really do gluten-free crepes and that maybe I should look at other menu items, which of course is not true and I have no idea why she said it. We finally asked for her to get a manager or chef to recommend gluten-free options. When the manager came, he was great at answering my questions and making basic allergy accommodations the way most restaurants do. Now, while it's a bit silly for a server not to know which items are gluten-free in a restaurant that's gone to the trouble of having a special gluten-free crepe batter, I don't really have a problem with a server not having all that memorized. The problem was that she wasn't offering to help us figure things out or check and, indeed, she didn't seem to understand basic questions well enough to give an on-topic answer! Yet again, I have no idea what was going on with that.

This place was ok...I ordered the Egg 'n' Turkey Bacon Waffle Platter, the eggs were fine, nothing to write home about, the waffle was burnt on the outside and not cooked on the inside and way too sweet. The potatoes were not 'au gratin', they were more like mashed pototatoes, but with some salt and pepper they were fine.

My boyfriend ordered the peanut butter and chocolate chip crepe, which was really yummy...probaby too sweet for a breakfast, but something we would probably go back and split for a dessert.

And as some other reviewers have mentioned, there doesn't seem to be proper ventilation from the kitchen, the whole place is kind of hazy and full of smoke from the kitchen. Sit outside if you can, at least until they install some overhead vents for their open kitchen.

We'll probably give this place another chance...but we'll see.

I've been here a few times and the food is always great!  Come early on the weekends because they are busy. The only downside is that my apartment's plumbing always gets overwhelmed by all the pooping my friends and I have to do afterwards.

I had the banana and nutella crepe and it was AMAZING! I wouldn't recommend their coffee--I have drank my coffee black for over six years now and I had to put cream and sugar in mine (first time in a VERY long time). I talked to a few other people that felt the same. I'm not sure what kind they use. I'm sure their lattes are fine. Our waitress was very nice. It may take them a hot minute to get to you but overall the service was good.

I should start by saying that my husband enjoyed his breakfast very much and the service was very good.  However I would strongly recommend that people avoid ordering the salmon crepe.  The quality of the smoked salmon is very poor and tasted like salmon jerky, additionally the goat cheese in the description was completely missing.  Additionally, I am a little bit of a coffee snob an the coffee they serve reminded me of bad hotel coffee.

The crapes are flavorful  and have several unique options. If you are in the mood for something more traditional in a crape you won't be disappointed. Service here it's some of the best in the city. On weekend mornings be prepared to wait a while for the tastiest treats in South End.

My wife and I live nearby and really like the atmosphere and clientele at the Crispy Crepe. However, the last two times we've been there have been bad experiences. One time we were seated outside, ordered our food, and waited more than 50 minutes before it came out. The second time, we ordered an Egg, Bacon, Cheese omelet for brunch to go, and when we got it home it was a vegetable omelet - not even close! If you can't get my order right, and when you do, it takes almost an hour, I will definitely take my business elsewhere.

We went last weekend and had a great experience (as usual).  We each got a chocolate peanut butter waffle and it was fantastic.  I usually get a cookies 'n cream waffle that they will make even though it is not on the menu.  Everything we have had here has been great!  It is definitely a place that we go to for a treat.  We will be back again!

Great place for breakfast on the weekend. Quiet noise level, but busy. Located right on South Blvd, there is plenty to watch as you eat. I had the Banana Pecan waffle, which was delicious. Paired with fresh fruit and a latte, it's my new favorite place to go on the weekend.

Fresh fruit and ingredients for the crepes, omelettes and fruit cups. Eggs were perfectly fluffy and tasty.  Coffee was too acidic for my preference, but maybe not for others. Service was fast for our Friday brunch. I'd definitely come again. Delish!

Waffle was awesome. Chipotle crepe was delicious and the chocolate peanut butter crepe was sweet, very sweet and I like that.  Crepe was not crispy but a chewier doughy type, which was fine for me, I like of that way.  Got a groupon to come here (never heard of it till then) and I will return.
Tasty food, great friendly service and good coffee. What more can you ask for on a cloudy Saturday morning.

Hey I'd give this place a thumbs up. Not alot of crepe spots in the Queen City, but hey. That's ok hit up Crispy Crepe for waffles, crepes or lunch. During my visit I endulged in the Cannoli Crepe ( pretty delishnessous) and the chedder and veggie crepe. The chedder and veggie was much healthier, but hey you gotta mix it up to keep them LB's off. The crispy crepe has healthy options and endulgence.  If I'm looking for a crepe or some waffles I'll will return.

I've been here twice.  The first time I ordered the waffle and I thought it was good, not great.  It had the lovely caramelized sugar nuggets that we all love, but I thought the waffle itself was a bit dense.  
Before I gave it a review, I wanted to give it a fair shot and order the restaurant's namesake, a crepe.  I'm so glad I went back!  The crepe was phenomenal!!!  I ordered the gyro crepe and was very happy.  The portion was huge and the filling was great.  It's something I honestly don't know if you'll be able to find anywhere else in Charlotte.  For dessert I got the S'Mores crepe to take home to my husband.  Once we started eating it, I realized I should've ordered two!  Again, excellent.  The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars was the slight disappointment in the original waffle.  I'll definitely be returning and ordering more crepes.

The service here was absolutely horrible. I saw servers walking around looking like they had nothing to do and bus people being extremely slow busing tables. However, due to it being Sunday there was a decent amount of people waiting for tables. We put our name on the list and waited. A couple that came in 10 minutes behind us were seated before we were and I had two people in my party. There were 6 to 8 servers and everyone at every table were having issues or problem with how slow service was, getting checks or even drinks. Once we are finally seated we ordered immediately because we saw how slow service was. It took them over 55 minutes serve us their special of the day and one of the regular menu items. My wife order to tea and it came with no spoon, she asked for more  sugar and that came 10 minutes later. I ordered a water and I couldn't get brought back until my food came out. Again due to the slow service I asked for the check when the food came out. It probably took them another 20 minutes to come pick up the check.

All that being said about this problems with the servers and the staff being slow, the food did taste very good and I would go there again but maybe just to pick up food.
The prices are way too high and the food is bad. You have been warned!

We were in the mood for good crepes and decided to give the  restaurant a try. The crepes were ok, however my daughter ordered a waffle. When the waffle arrived, it was yeasty and raw in the middle. The server said that people were complaining earlier in the morning that the waffles were overcooked, so the kitchen instead of cooking the waffles correctly, went in the other direction and now it was undercooked. The waitress took the waffle away and my daughter ordered a bacon/cheese croissant. The server said that the waffle couldn't be removed from the check, so we were charged for a waffle that was not edible and a dry and stale bacon cheese croissant that she couldn't eat. We asked to speak to a manager and the owner came over to the table and said that he was sorry and that was it!!! Over $50 of LESS than average food, which half of it was not edible..we will not be back!

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. 

  I just recently went here last Thursday around 10am to an uncrowded restaurant.  My server approached my friend and I to get our drink orders and seemed to be kind of in a rush to get back to her circle of server friends/breakfast eating at a table in plain sight at the back of the restaurant.  We both ordered the waffles with peppered turkey bacon selection, hastily as not to ruin my server's busy social life. I added a $3 topping choice to my waffle of strawberries and nutella, JUST strawberries and nutella nothing else. Our food arrived in a decent time, but was completely unseasoned and not necessarily appetizing. Our eggs were a little undercooked, which happened to be fine with me but not my friend. Our potatoes that were scooped from a steam well lacked flavor completely. Our COLD waffles possessed a yeasty almost raw taste(which we were later told is a common complaint among diners, and yet they haven't tried to fix it) and mine was topped with an excessive amount of whipped cream and chocolate syrup in addition to the strawberries and nutella,  that I hadn't ordered. It was pretty, but unwanted. And for this to be an open kitchen the line cook could have been a little more inviting to watch prepare our food. In an open kitchen, you're on display and most times people's entertainment for their meal. However, don't worry our server only popped back in enough to quickly see if we were ready for dessert(as if I could stomach that with the heaping pile of whipped cream I had on my waffle, nice selling tactic though) and for the check. I felt as though we were some what neglected,  until I noticed the table next to us barely be attended and then stumble across an error in their bill because they were trying to use a Groupon. I don't know the full situation, but their server kindly handed the situation over to who I assume was the manager who stood behind the counter the entire time and never cared to check on this table or anyone else, but the lady didn't seem to get her problem resolved. When she walked back to her seat she was confronted by her server explaining to her it was "corporate's" fault. I do have to admit that wasn't my burden to harbor, but the management team seems to be lacking severely here for letting their service team get away with what they do. The servers need to actually act like they like to work there, regardless if they do or not. I feel as though I paid A LOT of money to be pissed off and unhappy with this place. I didn't even bother getting our server to comp anything(not that I think they would after reading reviews on here) or to speak with the manager (if she should be so bothered). Its not like me to write reviews of places further than giving the stars, but I'd like to let people know DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME,  MONEY, OR ENERGY TO GO HERE!
Easy parking. Food and coffee are great (and also, I am pretty sure the food is halal)& great service

We had a late lunch on a Tuesday and loved it!  I had the tomato and arugula salad and my friend had bruschetta crepe.  The dressing and fresh mozz on my salad were delightful and the Au gratin potatoes they serve with the crepes are so good!  Iced late was good and service was decent.

We were really excited to try this place.  The crepe filling had great flavor but the actual crepe was very tough and chewy.  If you have ever had a good crepe you will not be at all impressed.  The waffle was just okay.  If it sticks around for a while I'm sure we'll hit it again to see if they have changed their batter.  Everything was fresh with good intentions but a commitment to one particular item means it has to be special.  It certainly was not special.  

The decorating is a bit awkward and appears unfinished.   Our food runner was very pleasant though a bit nervous.  I was still hungry when I left.  More calories burned chewing than ingested.  Best of luck Crispy Crepe.

My favorite brunch spot in Charlotte! Try the cookie butter latte! Incredibly delicious. For brunch, the Mediterranean crepe is a savory treat or for something sweet/amazing, enjoy the Nutella and strawberry crepe. It is packed with fresh strawberries and tastes like heaven! This restaurant also makes you feel like you're in Paris. What could be better?! Bon Appetit!
Went here for brunch with my girlfriend and we had the best service! The food came out quick and it was quite delicious. We will be coming back soon!!

If you get tricked into going to a niche cafe-type place by your friends when you aren't paying attention, hope that it's this place.
They have standard breakfast items, but I don't really know why anyone would order anything other than a crepe from a place called Crispy Crepe; so you can do what I did and ignore the few elitist reviews on here about turkey bacon and other nonsense.
I ordered a maple creme crepe, my friends ordered 'savory crepes' which are more meal-ish than the deserts. And because we all got to-go boxes and they all were forgotten in my fridge, I was able to take my pick from multiple delicious crepes this morning.
Their espresso is really nice and though I usually take cream and sugar, it was great just black.
One of my friends got a nutella milk shake which was awesome.
Expect to pay about $11 and some change for any crepe on the menu and that includes tax. If you get one of the 'savory crepes', chances are you'll have to take some home, so the price isn't bad at all.
If you're in the area, and there's not a crazy wait-time, it's a great place to stop in.

I bought a Living Social coupon to try this restaurant, i would have never have known about it otherwise.  The casual atmosphere will shock you with the gourmet food you will receive.  My daughter ordered the Roastbeef panini and loved it.  I had the shrimp crepe and my husband had the chicken chipole crepe.  We all LOVED our entrees!  For dessert  my daughter ordered the oreo crepe.  She loved it, but for me it was sugar overload.  my husband and I shared the Cookie butter waffle.  There are not words!!!!  Carmelized crispy sugar, bananas whipped creme!!!  We are already planning our next trip.  I read the comment about no coffee refills, that must have changed, we were offered free coffee refills, and had fast and very courtiest  service.  Love, love love this restaurant!!!!

Giggity giggity, giggity GOOD!

I am a serious fan of crêpes...and the Crispy Crepe must be a serious fan of me!  I'm not sure if there is anything that could knock a star off my five, based on the food alone.  We came here to grab a bite after the Charlotte "Thunder Road" marathon last weekend.  I am so glad we did!

Like many of my other reviews say...don't go to a steakhouse and review the chicken.  Enough said...get the crêpes.  

Which one should I get?  I got the Apple Streusel Crêpes.  Made from fire-roasted apples in a cinnamon caramel sauce, some crème fraîche, candied walnuts and a delicious crumble...you can't go wrong here.  Sooooo good!

As for the service and ambiance...you'll be fine.  In fact, the service is nice and so is the ambiance of the place.  Might get a tad warm...so take off your jacket.

Try:  Any of the crêpes

Avoid:  The Saturday morning rush hour
Absolutely love this place! Not a fan of smelling like food after leaving a restaurant (I usually eat outside during the warm months) but it's totally worth it lol.

When for a Sunday meal after church and was very disappointed.  The five of us (2 adults and 3 children) wait an hour for a table.  The staff act dumb founded as to how to find us a table.  We saw other who came in after us and got seated with little to no wait.  For the price the food was ok, but does not deserve a second visit. If wasn't for the rain and the hassle of driving somewhere else and getting the family wet again, then we would have left before seating. In a nutshell: seat can be limited and the staff is clueless.  I don't for see this place staying open too long.

Randomly found this place because of google reviews. Never been a big fan of crepes but decided to try one. I got the chocolate peanut butter one, it was super sweet but delicious! I could've eaten it as a dessert. I can't remember what my boyfriend got but he was pleased as well. The latte I drank was good too! The service was slow, especially since they weren't busy at all.

Breakfast is my favorite meal so I was anxious to try Crispy Crepe.  I went back and forth between the crepes and waffles, but settled on the Cookie Butter Liege waffle.  It was outstanding!  Great mixture of crunchy and chewy texture topped with bananas and whipped cream.  I was worried it was going to be too sweet, but it wasn't.  

Don't forget to order a latte.  I had a hazelnut latte and I would say it was the best latte I have ever had!  

Service was excellent.  A little pricey, but worth it.
I love their crêpes; the place is very cozy and clean, and the staff is very friendly and polite.

Waffles taste like cardboard in a press.  Never coming back.  

I came because of the good reviews.  I should have stuck with the Terrace Cafe.

Came here on Friday after dinner for dessert. 

-Prices: I thought the prices were pretty high. I think we paid $10 for one of the dessert crepes.

-Food: We ordered the maple crunch crepe to split. It was good, the filling was super thick though....nothing excellent. The best part about the crepe was the chocolate covered strawberry that came with it!

-Service: Nothing spectacular. Got us drinks, took our order, brought us food, and brought us the check. Just the basics.

-The problems: We arrived at 8:20pm on Friday night. The place closes at 9pm. We walked in and got a seat. There were a handful of other groups in there eating. Right after we ordered, they started stacking the chairs on top of the tables all around us. This was around 8:30! It was extremely distasteful and made us not want to be in there. We quickly ate our crepe and left. I worked in the food industry for many years and know that balance as an employee of wanting to close up, clean up, and get out of there as quick as possible. But putting the chairs on top of the tables 30 minutes before close, is probably crossing the line a bit! I really hope owners/management is reading this because if the place looks closed before it is actually closed, there goes evening sales. 

Unfortunately, we most likely will not return. We really aren't high maintenance people when it comes to eating place (actually we are probably some of the easier customers to please cause we are so passive!), but when I don't feel welcome, I don't want to be there.

I went here with my Mom after we dropped my daughter off for a 3 week trip to Greece and thought crepes would be a great reminder when my daughter and I were in Greece a few years back.

The staff were so pleasant and I loved our waitress who assured us our choices were good ones.  Seeing the portions were huge, I had the vegetable & cheese and split it w/ Mom. Our waitress asked if we're sharing and served us each half. Thank goodness because it was stuffed and would have been a mess trying to divide it. We had to get a sweet crepe so decided to split the Apple.....oh my!!!  That hit the spot...yes sweet but don't put sugar in your coffee because I wldnt have them change a thing.

All the previous complaints, I didn't experience but the tables weren't filled at 11:30 on a Tuesday.

I will be back with Hubby soon!!!

I have been here multiple times and feel like it goes downhill each time there. The atmosphere is plain and boring (let's throw up some French decor to make it feel right type of feel). The portions are so tiny for what you pay for. I ordered the 'special' of pumpkin spice crepes and they tasted good. The problem was I was starving when I left the restaurant. Aside from that, there was no price attached to the 'special.'  Come to find out it costs almost $15. Long story short breakfast cost almost $35 for two people and I felt like I had been had this last time. Batter and cream cheese and the effort to make it doesn't cost nearly what they charge. This used to be the only 'creperie' in town but now there are plenty others who I feel offer better food and quality of service for the price you pay. Plus South End in general has grown up a lot since the inception of this place and I feel like they need to grow up with the area too. Someone mentioned brunch was dead on a Sunday at 10am and that should be prime time for this place. That statement alone speaks volumes. Parking is also a pain at this place as a side note. Won't be returning.

Great small restaurant with great service. I got a house coffee (great- a little "weak" for my taste but you could tell the beans were freshly roasted and ground- it was a great, complex cup of coffee). 

My breakfast was an apple streusel crepe which was amazing- sweet, buttery, and cinnamony. My husband got the egg/veggie/cheese crepe. I actually liked his better for a meal, because by the end of mine I was on a sugar high. Both used high quality ingredients throughout! I think in the future, my husband and I could split a sweet and a savory instead of getting separate meals. 

Expensive compared to what we usually pay for breakfast ($40 after tip) but I don't mind paying extra for quality. Large portions. Neither of us could finish. We will be back!

This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to the historic south end of Charlotte near the Dilworth neighborhood to Crispy Crepe. 

Dora here. Hey, I recognize that cute guy in the red shirt! :)
I would've preferred to sit outside, but the Saturday afternoon of our visit was a scorching 95 degrees. The interior was cozy and air conditioned. Check out that giant bottle of chocolate syrup along the wall. How cool is that? 

This unique eatery not only serves crepes, but also waffles, salads, flatbreads and sandwiches. 

I chose the Egg n Turkey Bacon Waffle which is served with two eggs, turkey bacon and fresh fruit. Now this waffle is not an ordinary waffle. It is a Liege waffle, named after a city in Belgium, and is made using brioche style dough and caramelized Belgian sugar, and pressed in a cast iron press. 

This waffle was outstanding, definitely the highlight of the dish, and reminds me of waffles from our trips to Europe. The soft scrambled, not runny eggs and bacon were perfectly cooked. 

Dora here. Isn't that plate huge? I couldn't let Ernie eat that whole meal by himself!  He definitely needed help with the waffle. Wow! Yeasty and yummy and my fork kept sneaking over to his plate. :)

I strategized my order. I knew we were going for a sweet crepe, so I ordered the Smoked Turkey with White Stilten Cranberry Cheese sandwich. Doesn't that sound intriguing? I know, right? And look at it. Sweet caramelized onions, cranberry cheese...need I say more? Yummo! And to be fair, I did share. :)

The Chocolate Peanut Butter crepe was filled with mini chocolate peanut butter cups, vanilla cream & drizzled with caramel. The chocolate and cream, almost like a donut cream, all mingled together for a sweet ending to a great meal. Check this out!

Dora here. The crepes don't normally come split like this. Somebody was a bit too quick with the knife. Lucky I snapped a picture because this crepe vanished within seconds.

The coffee was a different story. Too weak for me. Bummer. 

Three hours of free parking is available in a garage around the corner. Service was a bit slow because of the packed restaurant, but you won't need that long to eat. :)

We rate this restaurant 4 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving great food. 
~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

Parking was difficult. Really liked my crepe, but others at the table didn't have the same experience. I won't be back soon unless it's for takeout -- the ventilation in the restaurant was horrible and the cook is very close to patrons, so fumes from cooking hung in the air (and my clothes) and left me with a headache.

The Crispy Crepe is fantastic! I had the Chipotle Chicken Crepe and was blown away. Add a little hot sauce on it and now you're talking! The fresh salad as a side is definitely the way to go, although the fruit looked really good.

Why not 4 or 5 stars? 
         Parking is kind of a bugger, park behind CC in the parking deck, limited spaces available to the public.
          The CC is crazy busy on the weekends so be prepared to wait.
           And lastly, the coffee sucked. But I'm a coffee nerd.

Groupon had round 2 of coupons for Crispy Crepe, so I decided to give them another try after a so-so first visit.

Well, round 2 was just not much better, but an improvement.

First big difference was that it wasn't the same, order and pay at the counter and we'll bring it to you sort of thing. This time, we were seated and had a server order our food and bring us our check, etc. This was definitely more relaxing. 

This time they also had their patio poppin'. We ate outside at like 7:30 on a Thursday in July, the weather and ambiance was perfect.

I tried the Crispy Cheese crepe this time. Unfortunately it just tasted like a cheese quesidilla. It wasn't bad, just boring and lacking in texture. The menu says it's served with a grape tomato relish, but it really was just a couple sliced grape tomatoes with a vinaigrette. I got the black bean and corn salsa-like salad as my side... not good, not bad. 

My boyfriend on the other hand, LOVED his crepe this time around. He ordered the Chipotle Chicken Crepe and was all about that thing. He ate every single bite and would totally order it again. 

So, we'll definitely be back so my boyfriend can order the Chipotle Chicken Crepe again and I will still be on a quest to find a decent vegetarian crepe option here.
Hubs and I had the cinnamon waffle and fresh fruit crepe. Absolutely amazing! Top off with the creme Brule latte....time for a nap!

The crepes and waffles are delicious! It can get a little pricey with upcharges, but the food is worth it. The cookie butter crepe is my personal favorite. The crepes are always fresh and light. The service is average, doesn't take too long to get food. Overall a great place for a breakfast splurge.

There are many places that are much better than, Crispy Crepe. Also, places where the staff and owner won't tell you that you don't fit in, due to your appearance. Living close by my friend and I decided to give it a try. I take it that most of their clientele isn't tattooed and pierced. I heard the owner describe me to our server and say, "this isn't the place for those people with their tattoos" I hated to break it to them, it's Southend not South Park.
The crepes are huge and amazing!!!!!!!!!!!! Highly recommend for hangover brunch!

The selection of crepes there is pretty sweet, no pun intended. But they also have some savory crepes as well if that's what your looking for at that time. But I first got the espresso, and that was made as good as any other espresso that I've had, so that is a plus for them. And I choose to have the sweet crepe and got the cheesecake crepe and the only thing that I have against the crepe was that it was extremely tough and had a really hard time eating it. But the filling was rich and decadent ( yeah that was an Anthony Anderson spoof lol). So all in all its not the best crepe I've had but it was good.

Discovered this place in a Buzzfeed list of the best places to grab breakfast in Charlotte. I was not disappointed! 
When we arrived, the place was packed. Even so, we were seated in a little under 30 minutes.
I got the cheese crepe with turkey bacon and my fiancée got the smoked salmon and goat cheese crepe. Both were delicious! 
And the must have of the experience: the cookie butter latte! Do not pass up this treat!
The only reason I didn't give a 5 star rating is the price was a bit high. Even so, we shall return.

Loved this place!!!  We stumbled upon it while out for a walk and decided to pop in for brunch. Couldn't decide between sweet or savory... So we each picked one and shared. Cookie butter waffle was devine as well as the Herb Ricotta Cheese and Spinach crepe. Will definitely be back!!!

Yum!! The food and drinks were amazing! I highly recommend the cookie butter coffee, it was a sweet treat that I've never had anywhere else! The wait was pretty atrocious, which means they are doing well for themselves (soooo, woo hoo) but I wish there was more areas indoors to wait to be seated especially on hot days. 

Service was great, kind of slow because of the number of patrons but I will definitely not fault them on that! I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and will definitely be back!

A few weeks ago, I visited the Crispy Crepe for the first time. I ordered the Cinnamon Roll Waffle. Now, in Crispy Crepe's defense, the waitress told me it was super sweet (And I LOVE sweets), but WHOA! It was so sweet and sugary I couldn't even enjoy it. Not a fan of this dish. 

I decided to give this place another shot today (based on its reputation alone) and ordered the vegetarian crepe. The veggie crepe was pretty good. The mushrooms gave the crepe a great texture and was paired nicely with the sautéed spinach and cheese. The potatoes that were served as my side were one of the best parts of my meal. 

I'll probably give this place another shot and try another meal in the future. I really want to like this place, but am not incredibly impressed.

This is my third time visiting crispy crepes and once again the food is amazingly good. 
I had the Smoked Salmon Egg Crepe and my friend had the bacon and egg crepe these are must try items.  

The maple cream pumpkin pie was good and the turkey bacon was great.  
This place is only for those willing to try different types of food and it's not your normal Waffle House type of menu. 

If your looking to try something new this is sure to be hit and you will enjoy CC. 

FYI this is not a place to have a business meeting being that it's extra loud when it's busy.

After spotting Crispy Crepe driving down South Blvd where all the new condos/apartments are, we decided to give it a shot this past Sunday morning.  Being Sunday morning, we were afraid there would be a long wait, but we gave it a shot anyway.  Fortunately, although the restaurant was busy, there was a table for us!  Since it was a beautiful day, it would have been nice to have sat at one of their covered tables on the sidewalk, but they were already all taken (another time then!).  

For being where it is, the restaurant is a decent size, and the interior with the big glass windows and modest decor give it a very cheerful, welcoming, clean feel.    I've never been that crazy about the open kitchen concept, but it wasn't bothersome for breakfast.  I guess I'm just one of those people who'd rather see and feel the ambiance of a dining room (especially when I'm dining OUT) than try to eat a meal in the throes of the kitchen where the chefs and servers are buzzing about.  

Crispy Crepe has a lot of lunch items but not as many breakfast choices as I was hoping, especially with the crepes.  There's only a couple of basic egg options.  So, with the promise of our table sharing one of the many, many dessert crepe choices (dessert for breakfast? yikes!), I went with the Egg 'n' Turkey Bacon Waffle Platter (with au gratin potatoes) so I could taste of variety of items during my first visit.  Everything was delicious.  The potatoes were really creamy and cheesy (not greasy).  I hoped they were fresh instead of from a package, but I couldn't be too sure.  The waffle was definitely a highlight.  It's called a Liège Waffle, which I've never had before.  It was very dense, but full of a lot of flavor that regular waffles don't have.  It stayed very crispy, too, even with the real maple syrup on it.  

At the end of the meal, we all split a Banofie Crêpe, which was a giant crepe filled with bananas and a butterscotch custard.  It tasted similar to Bananas Foster.  The crepe itself was light and delicious.  

Lastly, I must note the coffee.  It tasted good and came in a BIG cup.  I always appreciate restaurants with big coffee cups so I'm not waiting for a server to come around often to keep refilling my tiny cup/mug.  I only had to have one refill this time around (but our super-friendly and efficient server came around a lot anyway).  

Will we be back?  You betcha.
Great crepes...although it needs to open earlier and 7 days a week.  It seems that I have tried to go when it is closed as often as it is open.

I eat out all the time, and I can say without any hesitation, this was the most outstanding dish I've had in months: Bruschetta Crepe with chicken, with a side of fruit... Dessert was: Cookie Butter Waffle, topped with a chocolate covered strawberry. 
There wasn't a single bite of food left on either plates. 
Amazing service, decent atmosphere.. Sensational/fresh food. 
I only wish they were closer to my house, so I could eat Crispy Crepe daily. 
Only downfall: they're not open on Monday's.
The S'mores latte is super yummy. I got the egg and cheddar crepe and it's huge and so worth the stop if you're in town.The au gratin potatoes are soo good!

I'm surprised that this is the second review since I've already been there 3 times. Oddly, I still haven't tried a dessert crepe!  This new place in SouthEnd next to My Townhome is well located and a good spot to get a meal or a snack.

Our favorite dishes are the chipotle chicken crepe, the eggplant tartine (delish!) and caramelized waffles. The tartine came with a melange of roasted veggies including more eggplant that was awesome and I think I would like to have that as the side with everything (even though the orzo salad was great too). My friend enjoyed her portobello grilled cheese panini. The lemon peppered chicken crepe left a bit to be desired, and I wish that they had a creamy chicken and mushroom one like the delicious ones at Cafe Monte, or a shrimp artichoke one. 

They make crepes on site in front of you so it actually is a bit smoky in there, so they need to keep the door open or figure out the ventilation a bit better.  They didn't do too much with the upfit, so I think they could get a little more creative to make it feel more cozy.  But I look forward to returning and trying the salads and dessert crepes or chocolate dipped strawberries!

They need to change their name to soggy crepe. The only reason they're getting 2 stars is that the filling of the maple "crisp" (not crispy) cheesecake crepe was tasty.  
Even the coffee was watered down and ill-prepared. Save your money.

It was crowded as expected for a Saturday morning the wait wasn't too bad.  Once we were seated and ordered our food came out quick. Our server was nice and provided the special for the day, she wasn't pushy but observant and the place was crowded. I'll definitely go back!

Great service, atmosphere, and delicious food! 
Fresh perfection! I love that they offer a buckwheat option.

Charlotte is not a big crepe city so if you're looking for something unique in concept, give it a shot. Food's good - def a crowd (and a wait) on your typical weekend brunch times like Sun 10-1. 

Very laid back place to have a coffee and grab a crepe - as a meal, dessert, or just for fun.

We stopped for lunch and all had crepes, smoked salmon and vegetarian. They were excellent, as were the lattes. A Quebec lady in our group was pleasantly surprised to find maple syrup latte on the menu. The place was full and some people were eating on the outside terrace. The owner was cooking and supervising the open kitchen, always a good sign. I had the salad greens and absolutely loved the dressing, Portions were generous, we all loved this restaurant!

The Cookie Butter Latte is phenomenal. If you don't try anything else- try this. My friend had the veggie egg cheddar Crepe which was super awesome. I had the fruit medley Crepe. We also split the cinnamon roll crepe- which was the best! 

The service was great! Definitely give this place a try!

I'm actually surprised reviews aren't higher for this place. My husband and I had a great experience. We were there on a beautiful Saturday, right before the brunch busy time, however we got seated on the patio pretty quickly! Service was quick and the food was good. 

Per usual, I was so indecisive and had trouble deciding between a savory or sweet crepe. But alas, my sweet tooth always wins out and I got the cookie butter waffle and added strawberries! They were a nice touch, but be careful because it adds like $2.00! The waiter offered, so I agreed to add them. Be careful of those trickster "add ons." The hubs made me feel glutenous by ordering the healthy egg and veggie cheddar crepe. However, it was definitely nice to have a choice between sweet and savory. His was delicious, and the veggies give the color quite a pop!

I really like crispy crepe. The savory crepes are the best thing on the menu. They are very balanced. The sweet crepes are also good but it's pretty rare when I have a sweet tooth. The staff is always friendly and professional. The only thing that keep me from giving them five stars is that it's very smoky inside. After you've been seated for a while, it's get to the point that your eyes start burning. You can see a layer of smoke in the room. I'm not sure why they don't install better ventilation or keep either the front or back door open so the smoke can escape. Overall great for brunch but be sure to sit as far from the grille as possible or you will find yourself crying over you brunch.

I ordered the egg and waffle combo with au gratin potatoes and 2 pieces of turkey bacon. Au gratin potatoes were below average.. Waffle was super tough, very "bready" eggs were just ok, bacon was the only tasty thing on my plate. I regret not ordering a crepe, but will not be returning. Service was decent.

I visited Crispy Crepe for breakfast a couple of months ago. The food was good and the coffee was delicious! Our waitress was friendly and attentive. 

I came back this weekend for an after dinner treat. The waitress was obviously anxious to leave which made the experience very rushed and uncomfortable. The cookie butter crepe was good, but the coffee was just as cold as the ice water. 

Probably will not be coming back! #LivyOut

Wowwwwwwwww. I'm not sure how I've waiting almost two years after living in South End to try this place out. It's definitely one of my go-to brunch spots going forward. 

The caffe mocha was awesome, a great way to start your morning. 

Crepe wise, my wife & I split it chipotle chicken & the picorini (think Cesar salad) crepes. Both were delicious and I'd easily recommend them. The cheesy potato side great flavor & texture, and the side salad was probably the best "side" salad I've had at any restaurant. Their house dressing was almost like a pesto, and it was fantastic. 

I cannot wait to head back to this joint and try one of their authentic Belgian waffles.

The crêpes were amazing! I have been looking for a place that serves gluten free crêpes for a long time... The ones served here are wonderful! I got the scrambled egg and turkey bacon GF crêpe and my husband got the chipotle chicken crêpe. He says his was delicious and I know mine was! And then for dessert we had Nutella with strawberries and this is a testament to how wonderful the GF crêpes were we shared a GF crêpe! 
Kayla, our server, was friendly and gave good advice on what to eat. 
Only complaint was the temperature of the restaurant which did not affect the flavor of the food or our service. The restaurant felt like it was 80 degrees! 
We will be back! But maybe fix the AC please and thank you!

First, let me say that we entered the restaurant, but ended up not eating here for a couple of reasons.

We were passing through Charlotte on the way back to Asheville and were looking for a gluten-free option for food, before we hit the highway. We found Crispy Crepe through a Google search and Yelp directed us to their contact information and profile page on the Yelp website.

We called the restaurant to make sure they were still open. They were, as they close at 5 pm on Sundays. We made our way there, found parking, and proceeded to enter. It was before 5 pm, but the staff were already cleaning up, having mopped the floor with a strong cleaner, while people were still eating. It's my opinion that it is rude to mop a floor while people are eating. You impact the food smell, which is one aspect of the overall experience.

My wife is very sensitive to toxic chemicals, so we decided we'd do take out instead of dining in. When we stepped to the register, my wife asked about gluten-free options. The cashier had zero knowledge of what was gluten-free on the menu and what was not. She turned around to ask the person making the crepes and he was unsure if the sauce on one of the menu items contained gluten. It was clear that both employees lacked the knowledge or understanding of whether or not one of the crepes contained gluten.

From cleaning the restaurant with toxic chemicals (many restaurants are using green cleaners now) to having a passing interest in understanding their own menu, I was very disappointed with my first experience at Crispy Crepe. Fortunately, I live in Asheville, where they take these things seriously, instead of Charlotte, where it seems like there is little regard for people with both chemical and gluten sensitivities.

We ended up simply heading to Whole Foods to eat off the hot bar, because at least they list their ingredients and they don't clean around the food when you're trying to enjoy a meal.

Well, we enjoyed an early lunch here and were glad to have beaten the rush. Folks were piling in after we had ordered. We thought that this was a good sign. We both had savory dishes with-- the Chipotle Chicken being really tasty. Per the menu it consists of "Cumin crusted chicken slices topped with pico de gallo, jack cheese, sliced avocado & chipotle cream" and comes with a side orzo pasta salad.  All of these ingredients worked well together and tasted fresh.  I also tried a Caramel Macchiato. Although I could taste the caramel and hints of vanilla, I will ask for maybe an extra shot of espresso. It was a little weak for my tastes. Service was decent and the owners seemed nice and asked if all was good. Prices are moderate. We will have to come back and try some of the sweeter choices.

Food was decent. Service was poor.  Hostess and waitstaff were not very friendly nor helpful. Warm soda with three ice cubes (had to ask for more ice), the server was thrown off by a simple question ("how's your hummus?"), and we were given our correct bill and somehow when we got the card back to sign, it was the wrong amount.  Server and manager handled it really poorly and seemed inconvenienced by the request to make it right.  Not even an apology.  I would go back for the food, but not the experience.
Delicious food, made fresh and fast. Attentive and considerate staff. This restaurant is consistent every time we have come!

The wife and I have now been here on several occasions and the food and service has always been great. The crepes are huge and tasty with plenty of filling whether they be sweet or savory. 

Overall, we have tried the vegetarian, smoked salmon, chipotle chicken and shrimp  crepes, and they are all great. The crepes all come with sides and the daily salad has easily been the best with variations on tabbouleh and chick pea salad. My only gripe is the kettle chips as a side, which were really just regular potato chips from a bag, and not even kettle chips. Also, last time I took a shawarma lamb sandwich, which was a good change of pace, but I would be hard pressed to say that is was better than the crepes.

For the dessert we usually take a waffle and our favorite is the maple delight, but the banana butterscotch is a close second. The lattes and espresso here is also pretty good if you need a little caffeine pick me up. We shall return often.
This place is a must if you are in South End for breakfast or an early lunch. Their savory crepes are super yummy.

This is my favorite weekend breakfast location. The crepes are so delicious, and we love sitting outside on the patio to eat. The coffee and specialty drinks are also amazing. Service has always been very efficient. Highly recommend!

Crispy Crepe is easily one of the best places in Charlotte for Sunday Brunch. Always great food, service and presentation. HOWEVER! Until they fix the ventilation, don't even consider sitting inside. Pray the weather is nice and choose the patio. Had a great meal today, but was chased out by thick smoke that burned eyes and left clothing smelling like we'd just worked the grill. With an efficient ventilation system, Crispy Crepe would be an easy 5 Stars.
Tasty food, very nice interior, good service. great side walk seating and people watching.

I accidentally wrote my review in the check-in -_- 3/26/17 was my 3rd visit. I love this place. Their crepes are huge and I'm always satisfied, the side of potatoes is great as well. My favorite savory crepe is the egg and veggie with cheddar cheese. This last time I had them use herbed goat cheese instead...I now have a new favorite. My companion ordered the smoked salmon with goat cheese, I'm getting that one next time. The staff here are equally amazing.

Had heard some good things about this place and was excited to check it out. I'm not the biggest fan of crepes, but thought it was cool that another creperie was opening in town. 

Located on South Blvd, the parking can be a little hairy. You'll have to grab a meter or score a spot in one of the close garages. Not my ideal situation, but it's pretty cool that it's right off of the street. There is some outdoor seating with umbrellas which are nice, too. Always great to see the hustle and bustle on South during the day. The interior is pretty spacious. Plenty of tables and a small lounge area with some comfy chairs. Tons of natural light coming in their large windows, too. Very welcoming. 

The open kitchen is a HUGE plus, too. Always fun to watch someone make crepes. Great for kids. 

I had no idea when the menu held, so I went with the first sweet crepe on the menu. Maple Cream. This is where these guys lost it for me. It was a pretty standard crepe. Some whipped cream and fruit on the side. But....filled what was the equivalent of low-grade paper canister icing that you find in the grocery store. The worst part? There was SO MUCH of it. It was so overpoweringly sweet that I had to discard almost all of it for it to be slightly enjoyable. Really disappointing. Though, I think some of their savory crepes would be more enjoyable. Hoping to check those out next time. 

I can't say I'll be rushing back it anytime soon, but these guys have a pretty cool setup. Really dig the open kitchen and think some of their concoctions are cool. Worth a shot, in my opinion. Just ask for LESS maple cream, should you venture down that road.

Went in today for breakfast and there was no wait. It smelled amazing inside and I couldn't wait to order. Our server, Shana, was attentive and sweet and very prompt. I ordered the apple streusel crepe, which was bigger than I thought it would be, and SO tasty. My husband got a savory salmon crepe and said it was excellent. I also ordered one of the tastiest chai lattes ever. I definitely want to come back.
So good I forgot to take the pic before I ate it. Portion to price is great. The fruit was perfect and fresh. The service was excellent. Thank u for a great Sunday morning.

The food and service are fine. However, the smoke from kitchen is floating around the whole restaurant, which makes me feel terrible. They definitely need to improve the ventilation system inside the room, otherwise, I will never recommend people should come here for food

Wow oh wow oh wow. These crepes are to die for! I always enjoy a sweet one when I decide to get crepes cause you basically get dessert for breakfast and who doesn't love that? I got the apple streusel and it tasted like a warm little apple pie wrapped up in a crepe. SO GOOD. My friend got the cookie butter crepe and the bananas perfectly compliment the cookie butter as not to make it too too sweet. My boyfriend ended up with the chipotle chicken crepe as it was pretty close to lunch at this point. As someone who was skeptical about crepes and had actually never had one, he loved It and was excited to eat his leftovers later that day. 

The service was really quick! We were quoted half an hour wait for 3 people but only waited about 15. After we ordered, our food took maybe 10 minutes to receive and not much longer to devour! I would most definitely come here again for breakfast/brunch!

They have hands down the best crepes I have ever had! I got the Bruschetta Crepe and added chicken and it was amazing! The flavors were so developed, the crepe was thin, everything was perfect. I got a side of Au Gratin potatoes and they were delicious, not too overwhelmingly cheesy! I also ordered a Fresh Fruit Medley Crepe and it was really good too. I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but I liked it! The sweetness was not too overpowering and the whipped cream definitely helped soothe it a bit. The decor is so adorable and chic, I love it. Our waitress was so nice and even wrote "Thanks" on the receipt. I will definitely be back.

So, I really hesitated about the appropriate number of stars for this place. I wish I could give 4.5. I mean, in the category of casual eateries, it probably deserves 5 stars, but compared to all restaurants I've been to ever in my life, 4 seems more appropriate. Moving on--the food. We hesitated to try the Crispy Crepe due to the lukewarm reviews, but I am sure glad we stopped in tonight. Our server was great and helpful (not to mention right on target) with menu selections. We had the Mediterranean, Apple Brie, and Bruschetta crepes for our meal along with fruit and the salad of the day (rice and asparagus). It was all delicious. The crepes themselves were just right, crispy edges, mmmm. I read another review that described both the Mediterranean and Apple Brie crepes as bland. They must have changed something since that review. All of the crepes were flavorful and amazing fresh from the kitchen. The Bruschetta crepe suffers a bit from sitting around (I nibbled the leftovers from the plate of one of my kids, and it was not as good as it was right at first), so it might not be a good choice for takeout. The combination of the brie and apples is tasty (not too sweet). The pesto on the Bruschetta crepe is so yummy and delicious. The Mediterranean manages to capture all those flavors you expect in that kind of crepe, the saltiness of the olives and tanginess of the vinaigrette. The spinach was clearly fresh too. All in all, they were delicious. The kiddos ate them up too. We tried an old standby for dessert, the banana and Nutella crepe. You just can't go wrong and Crispy Crepe does it right. It was very good. I'd say it was better than that other option in town for crepes and way way cheaper. For $35 we were stuffed! Will definitely return!
Butter cookie latte could put Starbucks out of business it was that good, and if you leave hungry, you're a BIG eater.

Such a cute place.   Small bistro seating about 40-50 people. They have a large selection of savory and sweet crepes along with other items.  I had the bruschetta crepe with chicken.  It was large, way to large for one person and it comes with a side.  I choose the salad.   Perfect little salad.   The crepe was very tasty but had to much of the pesto oil.   If you choose this maybe tell them light on pesto.   You can always add more.

This place is breakfast/brunch nirvana. Pick between a wide range of sweet or savory crepes. As well as my favorite brunch item, the schwarma lamb pita wrap. I can taste it in my dreams. Last time I went I also tried the smoked salmon crepe which was life changing. Only downside to this place is it's only open til 3pm! On street parking only.

Sweet treats abound at Crispy Crepe. In addition to the crepes, they have liege waffles and creative coffee drinks. For those who arent aware, a liege waffle is different and much better than a normal waffle. These belgian style waffles are filled with pearl sugar that caramelizes when cooked. Theyre more like desserts than breakfast dishes. My favorite crepe is the fresh fruit medley which is filled with strawberries, bananas, and honeydews then topped with a dulce de leche sauce. The menu description says that is also includes kiwis but I have never seen a kiwi in this crepe and Ive ordered it several times-I wish theyd actually start putting them in. One of my only complaints about Crispy Crepe is that their menu descriptions are also inaccurate. The bananofie crepe is good but I was a little peeved about the misleading menu description. This crepe is supposed to be filled with bananas and a butterscotch custard. I love custards so I was a bit dismayed when my crepe arrived and was topped with a butterscotch sauce instead of a custard-not the same thing! It was still very tasty but I think it would be even better with a real custard. Ive never had a chance to order the coffee drinks because its hard for me to drink a sugary drink while also eating a sweet dish but one day, Ill have to come in to get coffee and nothing else. The butter cookie latte sounds intriguing. Overall, very good but beware of the fact that what you order may not match the description exactly!

Great location the food is exceptional and as fresh as it gets. Anyone that eats there must try the Chipotle Chicken each bite is like a bit of paradise. The service from start to finish was first class, I promise to be a great experience that will have you returning for more.

Came in on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately seated. I ordered the apple and brie crepe-- my first time trying a savory crepe. The food was delicious, nice serving sizes, and friendly waitress. I'll be back again!

I'm not a crepe expert but I'm sold. I went in expecting to find a bunch of sweet crepes but was completely caught off guard with all the non-sweet crepes on the menu. 
I ordered the chocolate Nutella crepe with bananas, and I am a chocolate lover. I ashamed to say there was just too much chocolate! Lets not talk about that ever again. 
The crepe came with an awesome side of pineapple & chocolate covered strawberry. 
I need to go back and try a savory crepe!

Unfortunate experience, very poor customer service, above all... Not dog friendly. Waitress had to be reminded multiple times to bring silverware, to refill our water glasses and no dog bowls for our puppy.
I love this place! Great food and great service! They never disappoint. I recommend it to everyone.

Great atmosphere and awesome food.

The waitress was REALLY off (slow, distracted, taking smoke breaks) but not bad enough to spoil a great lunch.

We will be back!!!

PS- They seemed to have quite a few fruit flies/gnats also.  :-/

My first visit.  Parking is in parking garage.  Small place, but nice and quaint.  Ate outside due to not enough umbrellas the sun beat down on us pretty hot.   Took 10 mins for waitress to take order.  35 mins. For food to come.  The food was worth the wait. We had the apple strudel crepe and the turkey bacon and egg crepe.   All in all a very nice brunch.

Sooooo... I didn't order a crepe but the waffle is more than likely just as good as them. It's sweet but not too sweet with the German sugar... Towards the end it did start to taste a little too sweet. Maybe it's because of the White Hot Chocolate... Which might I add was REALLY GOOD!!! Not too hot, just right. Creamy, buttery flavor. Definitely better than the White Hot Chocolate from Starbucks. 

Anyway, the potatoes au gratin is aaaawwwesommmme!!!!  And the turkey bacon is on point. Not like that fake stuff you buy in the store. I really would have been good with the bacon, potatoes, and hot chocolate. 

My eggs weren't really cooked right, but in light of the other parts of my dish... I could ignore the eggs. 

Nice spot for some brunch.

I think I'll try a crepe next time. Savory or sweet? Who knows?

I love crepes and this place does them VERY well. Good choice of savory and dessert crepes with good, bold house coffee. We're huge fans of brunch - who isn't - and this is one of our go-tos. Oh and very family-friendly with a good amount of parking in the back.

First time here and was with my nephew and his friends for about after church meal in Easter. Apparently,  we were there at the right time. First thing that caught by eyes was the service Nicole was our server...knowledgeable and really listened to ensure that my omelet was as I wanted it. W. Food presentation awesome as was the taste. My nephew stated u hit a home run.  I felt so as well.  Will be back. Thanks Nicole for making our dunning experience a great one.

Went here for easter brunch. There is a parking deck which is really nice since parking is sometimes hard to find in south end. They have a good amount of seating and there is patio seating as well. We were immediately seated and we ordered a cookie butter latte and an Americano. The cookie butter latte was SO good. Way better than anything Starbucks has to offer. For brunch, I ordered the chipotle chicken crepe with the Au gratin potatoes. The crepe was really good, the best crepe I've had in the charlotte area. It was more than enough food for me and I actually couldn't finish it all. Can't wait to go back and try some of the sweet crepes!

First off- I love crepes. Breakfast, dinner- whatever. My husband and I decided to check it out a few days ago for dinner....DELISH!!! This place gives the Crepe Cellar a run for its money. Plus, you have a ton more crepe options than other local places and their lattes are out of this world (what a great combo). The portion is pretty large- I had to take my crepe home and it was even just as good for the following day. I ordered the chicken bruschetta crepe with the scalloped potatoes. Melt in your mouth crepe, which was crusted in garlic and cheese. I started off with some French onion soup as did my husband- a great starter. We finished off with a Nutella and strawberry crepe with a cookie butter latte- all I can say is it.was.awesome. 
Our server was also extremely attentive and offered some really good recommendations as we had not been there before. This is going to be my new crepe place to go.

Was heading towards Carrabba's for Lunch and my friend noticed several patrons sitting outside the patio and wanted to check out this cafe.

This is a very spacious eatery. Once you walk it, the staff noted you can sit anywhere you like. We wanted to be by the open kitchen to see how they prepare the crepes and waffles.

We ordered the Mediterranean Chicken Crepe and the Grilled Marinated Shrimp Crepe. Bother crepes was delicious. Large portions and perfect size for brunch, lunch or dinner. They did not have salmon crepes which was my favorite.

There were refills for coffee and tea. Staff checked to see if we wanted refills and water.

For those allergic to certain food make sure staff knows. My friend is allergic to onions and told waiter to remove out of crepe which they forgot when the crepe was brought out. Informed waiter again and they took care of it right away.

Will be back to try the sweet crepes the next time I am in the neighborhood.

As you walk out the door look out for bowl of water for the dog. Almost stepped into it.

Metered parking outside of the restaurant. Whole street on South Blvd is metered parking. Make sure you have coins available.

Crispy Crepe has a lot to offer.  This is a staple back-up breakfast place for us for a long time.  The location is great, right in south end outside of uptown.  The restaurant is not huge, but they do have (dog-friendly) outside seating which is nice.

The food is consistently good. They have a lot of options and an expansive drink list which is always fun.

Unfortunately the last time we were there we had a waitress who put a bad taste in my mouth (no pun intended), so I'm compelled to keep my review short to be fair the the restaurant.  CC is great, this waitress was terrible.  Not a review for yelp.

We will be back!
Great place for breakfast. Love their Mediterranean wrap (not sure of the right name). Crepès are great and they always give chocolate dipped strawberry with fresh whipped cream with Crepès. Awesome.

The first time I tried this place out, the service was S - L - O - W. They were understaffed that night but the place had no more than 10 customers so it shouldn't have been an issue. A good time to go is during lunch, surprisingly. There isn't much of a crowd. I am a fan of the bruchetta crepe. It's got a lot of flavor and texture and is very filling. My favorite is the roasted eggplant flatbread. It's served like a pizza pie, big enough to share for two. Packed with so much flavor it'll rock your senses. I'm already craving it as I type this out. Definitely don't leave without trying a dessert crepe. Can't go wrong with any of them but anything Nutella always hits the spot. They also offer gluten-free crepes, so that's a plus for those seeking that option. Oh, and, try to be seated as far away from the kitchen area as possible or you'll walk out smelling like grease.

Crispy Crepe is SUPER yummy! I am not a huge fan of crepes, but the Cannoli crepe was amazing.  My only beef-- the place is open to the kitchen, which is nice; however, there does not seem to be much ventilation.  My suggestion, sit outside.

P.S. - They also have really good coffee!

My husband and I have probably been to Crispy Crepe over 10 times.  They see us coming and greet us with "welcome back"  at this point.  I have tried quite a few menu items but the Cookie Butter Waffle is my favorite.  The waffles have a yeast flavor (not our American type waffles.. read about the caramelizing pearl sugar, non-bromated flour, etc. on the CC site).  It is served with the Biscoff European Cookie Butter, whipped cream, bananas, and topped with a chocolate covered strawberry.  :)  It is just big enough to leave me satisfied, but not stuffed!  The waffles are not huge, but are thick, Belgian-style.

The Bruschetta (add chicken) or Caesar Crepe (I forget the actual name) are both wonderful.  My husband enjoys the eggs, turkey bacon, waffle and gratin potato dish, but does wish they offered regular bacon. (Not turkey bacon fans). He also enjoys their sandwiches.  My vegetarian son loves a lot of their dishes, crepes, and coffees.

The owner is very nice and on Mother's Day (after eating a large lunch at Cowfish) I wanted a Cookie Butter Waffle that evening.  They treated us like royalty and even brought me out a flower for Mother's Day (my second of the day).  I thought that was very considerate.  The interior is very European (reminds me a lot of Cafe Monte in SouthPark, if you have been there.. very French).  Outside patio seating is available.  Parking is in the rear in a HUGE (free) garage for those of you who are having a problem with that.

We had one slow waiter experience, which we over looked since they were in training, and one take out apple/brie crepe that was not so hot.. (eat these crepes while they ARE crispy)... not so hot for take out, as they do lose their crispness in a take out container.

I have never minded the kitchen (it is glassed off from the main dining area & I enjoy seeing them at work), and our food is always hot from a heating lamp they use to keep the entire meal hot while getting it ready to bring to the table at one time.  

I have not yet tried the salads, but they look fantastic.  They do gluten-free dishes, also.  While I usually eat gluten free, I have found I can eat these waffle with the non-bromated flour without problems.  I will definitely be continuing to visit Crispy Crepe for my Cookie Butter Waffle fix! :)
Fun different types of crepes the bruschetta and cookie butter crepes were so good and the lattes are beautiful. Worth the wait
I got a flat bread but it was more of a salad with mushy bread.  I wish I would have skipped straight to dessert & only gotten the sweet crepe.  I had the apple crepe and it was wonderful.

OK, I've been here a handful of times and I think it's ready to give the Crispy Crepe my honest review: It's as good as everyone says it is!

Personally, I think it's one of the best crepe spots in Charlotte. It's usually busy on the weekends so make sure you get here early or you will wait. However, I've noticed they always tell me it's a longer wait than it really is. Last time the wait was "45 minutes", but we only waited 20. 

Anyways- to the good stuff:

Chipotle Crepe (Chicken, Pico de Gallo, cheese,avocado & chipotle cream): You can't go wrong with chipotle. It's got a little kick to it, but nothing too over powering. If you're not a fan of spice, ask for a side of extra sour cream with it and definitely extra pico! 

Spinach Goat Cheese Crepe (Ricotta cheese with sundried tomatoes, cheese, spinach & roasted red pepper pesto): First of all, add chicken. It's bangin! You can also add chicken to any veggie crepe for a slight up-charge. This crepe is the bomb.com and one of my favorite savory crepes. So delicious! 

Pecorino Chicken (chicken, romaine, parmesan & creamy caesar dressing): Basically it's like a chicken ceaser salad wrapped in a crepe and it's delicious! But it's also really big so come hungry! 

Waffles: Pretty good- super dense and a little aggressive if you eat it yourself. You might be in a sugar or chocolate coma after it so think about splitting it with someone else first. I had the Cookie Butter one and was in heaven while eating it.

For sides, the salad is good and I love their dressing - a creamy pesto basil dressing (?). The potatoes are also a must! They are so cheesy and delicious. 

For the 2 pairs out there- do yourself a favor and order one crepe and one waffle or one savory crepe and one dessert crepe. Get the best of both worlds. Plus, the servers are happy to bring you an extra plate if you share.

I like this place a lot. I went Friday morning, it was no waiting line, we got nice table close to the window. The service was friendly. I loved the crepes!!! My was with cheesecake filling, and it was very sweet, as for me, but I combined it with my husband's crepe with chicken as the result I was happy. Nice place for breakfast!

Mediocre restaurant at best, but if you plan on visiting any of their neighboring business and you parked in their designated spots (even after they're closed) your car is probably going to get towed. Also, while on the phone asking about the where abouts of my car (no signs saying who to call) the manager proceeded the tell the girl who answered the phone, 'if anyone asks the speak to the manager tell them I'm not here'. Great look guy, wont be coming back here any time soon, and I'll make sure none of my friends do :)

Crispy crepe is one of those places that becomes a fantastic addition to your regularly visited collection of eateries. It has everything on the menu from savory and sweet crepe entries as well as options for your gluten free and vegan friends. 

I recently visited with just such a group where we had gluten free and vegan requirements and both parties were extremely pleased. I had the chipotle chicken crepe and it was delightful. The portions were very substantial and being a 6'1" guy with a healthy appetite I was satisfied. 

The staff is very friendly and helpful and the decor is pleasant. The restaurant also features an outdoor patio and a good brunch menu for this sunny afternoon weekends.

My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday at 10:00am. We figured we would have to wait but surprisingly we sat right down. The server greeting us with water and asked if we wanted anything else to drink. We did not feel rushed and the server gave us time to look over the menu. 

My boyfriend got the strawberry Nutella crepe and I got the Brushetta crepe with potato au gratin and added Chicken for $2.99. 

Our food came out fast (mind you it got really busy when we sat down!) 

The Brushetta was huge! And the Nutella crepe was to die for! 

Overall the service/food was fantastic! We look forward to coming back !

My cousin and I visited Crispy Crepe and used a Living Social coupon for $20 which covered the entire tab.  This place has changed format since the last time I came.  It used to to be more of a self service and order at the register type place but now it appears to be full service and sit down.

We ordered two crepes - one sweet and one savory and split the two which was absolutely perfect portions and flavors.  The Mediterranean crepe is like a Greek salad with chicken in a crepe and was very tasty and an interesting blend of flavors.  The Bonafie crepe was absolutely amazing with butterscotch and bananas.  Every bite was just the perfect amount of sweet and crispy and so tasty. 

The service was attentive and prompt.  Using the Living Social coupon ($10 for $20) and leaving a $5 tip was an incredible deal of $15 total for two adults to eat some excellent food with great service.  I would highly recommend this place especially if you can each get a sweet and savory crepe and split them.

The parking is past the restaurant down at the bottom of the building in the garage.  It may be a little tricky if you've never been to that building before but it's still a very short walk to the restaurant.

The food is amazing! I went during a weekend and it was busy but it was worth the wait. The service was great too!
 
I ordered the butter cream crepe and the creme brûlée latte! It was all delicious!

This was a pleasant surprise. First day in Charlotte on a multi-day visit and was looking for something good for breakfast. I went out on a limb and gave a Crispy Crepe a try even though seeing it had a 3-star Yelp rating. My experience was great overall. It's worth mentioning that I visited at a time when they were nowhere close to being busy. It was a weekday (Thursday?) morning around 10:30am. The place was basically empty and service was PROMPT!  We chose to sit outside as the weather was very cooperative.  I ordered the Egg 'n' Turkey Bacon Waffle platter but paid a $4 upcharge to make it a cookie butter waffle. I really wanted to grab a crepe from here too (because it's part of their name!), but couldn't justify adding another $12 to my tab when I was already going to be full from the other stuff. Anyhow, the food was it to me within 5-10 minutes of me ordering. And it looked exactly as picture on the menu!  Since when does that happen?!?!  Cheese & eggs scrambled well, hash brown casserole, turkey bacon, and of course the waffle. I think the attached picture just about says it all, but everything was done to perfection. Eggs were a little small on the portion size but they were good. Next was the hashbrown casserole that had cheese in it. Besides needing a little salt, it was awesome! Turkey bacon was thick cut and full of flavor. And the dough-based waffle was very much dessert for my breakfast. It was larger than expected and the texture was great. I'm not a big fan of whip cream so I could've done without that and I don't eat strawberries so I gave away the chocolate-dipped strawberry that was on top. But the food here was as good as I could ask for. The waitress was friendly and helpful in helping my decide what to get. They are not "cheap" but as long as you come in knowing that, you won't be surprised/disappointed by pricing. I checked the menu online before dropping in. There was free 3hr garage parking in the back (no validation required) for restaurant customers. Would highly recommend to anyone without hesitating. Good job Crispy Crepe, good job!

So In-Love with this place small nice and cozy! My sister, son and I arrived at noon for lunch during the week, we were promptly seated and our waitress arrived right after.
Food was Great... I ordered Chicken Chipotle Crepe & a S'mores Latte... The best latte I've had!!! 
Great customer service & Great Food!!! 
Definitely coming back to Crispy Crepe & try new items on their menu.

My partner and I went there for brunch over a weekend. When we were sat the restaurant was only about half full. The tables around us were being served but no server helped us for about 15 minutes. When we were were finally approached by a waitress she told us " I didn't see you, you should've waived your hands to signal me."

I ordered a "House Specialty" the waffle and egg combination... my partner ordered a side of hummus... both where very bland and tasteless, so we stopped eating after a few bites. I noticed several others around us that only ate a few bites as well.

The server asked us how everything was, we told her that it was bland ... she then said "Don't blame me, I don't make it!" She then came back with the full bill and we then asked to speak to the manager. He then came over and we told him the story and he ended up comping our meal, with the waitress yelling as we walked out.

This was a nice experience.  I thought the service was great, and I liked the open kitchen.  I tried two crepes, the nutella&banana and brie&apple.  My side item was the au gratin potatoes.  I thought the food was slightly above average, but not great.  All in all it was very nice and I'll return to try other menu items.

Overall I had a good experience at this establishment. I got the cookie butter crepe which was a bit soggy but still good! The decor was quaint, and our waitress was friendly. I liked how there were plenty of options for both sweet and savory, I would come back but I will say I have had better crepes!

We went there on New Year's Day and it was crazy busy.  First time there.  The owner and the wait staff were EXTREMELY friendly!  The food was hand made and very good.  The side of fruit included strawberries and pineapple...not like most restaurants that give you mostly melon.  This really impressed me!  The atmosphere was also great!  However, it is a little pricey.  We will return :)

Response to Said G of crispy crepe 

Actually your waiter did not state that you guys didn't have ranch. He just said "the chef left" and that the person cooking the food wouldn't be able to fulfill my order. I've never had a problem with other restaurants having an issue with either taking the food off of my bill or letting me try something different, I mean none of those options were given to me.
