Especially if the customer barely touched their food. So that's just terrible customer service because if the customer isn't happy you should try everything to satisfy the customer. Long story short you guys need to take notes from HAZELNUT CREPERIE because they have the best crepes in charlotte & they're not soggy. They consistently have good crepes that are crispy with that being said y'all have poor customer service & the food sucks :) no wonder hazelnut creperie has better reviews than crispy crepe lol

They have Waffles, Sandwiches and Crepes some Mediterranean influences for sure and I asked for one of the Sandwiches to be made as a Crepe they said "Sure"!  Chicken Shawarma with Feta, Red onions and Eggplant marinated in Moroccan Spices, with Tahini lemon Vinaigrette, Served with a side of Couscous???  Everything was Incredibly Fresh!  They were very Busy for 1:30pm (Black Friday) and Incredibly Fast!  They have only been open about a week!

Open Kitchen!!!  You can watch them grilling the food and making the Crepes!

Fantastic Service! Everyone was very Friendly and Efficient!

The food was good, the service was horrible.  I had the waffle and my boyfriend had a savory crepe.  The service was very lackluster.  We were seated and forgotten about.  No clue where the server went, so we grabbed another waitress in the area.  Go in to wash our hands prior to eating and she was lingering, socializing with coworkers.  The replacement server wasn't much better.

Ended up here after other plans fell through and we are glad we did! We went on a sunny Sunday about noon and only had to wait around 10 minutes for a table. When you walk in you can see the open kitchen and and glass wall that allows customers to see crepes being made. The restaurant feels cozy and perfect for brunch. We enjoyed the ricotta and spinach crepe and the egg, cheddar, and veggie crepe both with buckwheat crepes. I was thrilled to see buckwheat crepes as an option on the menu, as I
loved the savory buckwheat crepes I enjoyed in Paris earlier this year! The crepes were perfectly cooked, the fillings delicious and the portions huge! I look forward to going back to try a sweet crepe as well.

We also both ordered pumpkin chai lattes with soy milk, I found the drink cloyingly sweet and almost unpleasant to drink due to the sweetness. I would go back for a sweet crepe instead.
Great food. Issues with host and seating. Probably would go back with less expectation.

Just OK.

Had lunch here today.  My girlfriend and I were both remarking on how we liked it, until we got the bill.  It was very overpriced.

I got the signature chipotle chicken salad served on flatbread.  It tasted like a gordita from Taco Bell.  That's not to say it was bad, but if I wanted taco bell that's where I would have gone.   The chicken amount was skimpy, but what was there was very flavorful and well cooked.  I just can't get over how similar the flatbread tasted to the Taco Bell entree.  It was very strange, but I did like it.  Anywho.  For dessert I got the cookie butter waffle.  These are dough waffles, not batter waffles - and I've had them done better (see Cast Iron Skillet in South Park), but it was still yummy.  I'll probably ask them to go light on the cookie butter topping next time.  The low light of the meal was the side of au gratin potatoes.  It was not good.  My dinning companion agreed.  I should have listened to my fellow yelpers. When will I learn.

So the smallish taco bell like entree, the desert and an Ice tea was 26 plus tip.  I think that high.  They also screwed up my waffle.  I asked for no whip.  The kitchen messed it up - not the waitress.

Also a few other comments:
 1. The restaurant itself is cute, but the open kitchen allows for that grease smell.  We both left smelling like old Chinese food.  

 2.  Management really should keep employees from congregating/eating in the dinning room.  Twice I had to walk back to the restroom and both times there were staff hanging out in the back table. Patrons have to past them to use the facilities.  I found it unprofessional..and more importantly, the table had unsightly half eaten take out and other garbage on it.  Also the bathroom could be cleaner. It wasn't terrible, but I think they get a lot of foot traffic from passers by due to it being tucked back by the back entrance. I.e. folks can slip in and out w/o anyone seeing them..

So to sum it up..my waffle was yummy and I LOVE waffles.  I'll go back for that alone..and I'll get water cause the prices are steep yo.

This is our typical post workout weekend spot. We always share a crepe and sandwich. I haven't tried any of the amazing looking, sugary/dessert crepes, but they are so wow! I go for more of the turkey, chicken and lamb dishes with pesto and avocado ingredients, and they are always great. They also have a nice coffee bar with speciality cafe drinks that I usually partake in. Would come here just for that. They have a nice patio outside on South Blvd, which is great for sunny Saturdays. If you're in for a fairly quick, flavorful lunch - I highly recommend this place. We've gotten the same waitress three times, and while she never remembers us, she has given us pretty good service each time. She will forget about us and then run over to make sure we're ok, I appreciate the hustle and effort. All in all, haven't had a bad meal here yet and continue to order new things. Definitely recommend you try this place!
A must for breakfast or Brunch in Charlotte, the wait can be a little long, but the food is great.

I'm a huge fan of Crispy crepe. pick your favorite savory  crepes on the menu  and you will  surely enjoy whatever you pick. The interior  is clean with touch of French  style decor. the people  are friendly. Look  for Raven. She got such a delightful personality. :) And Hey  don't go home without  their crispy crepe  desserts :)

Was excited for this place to finally open as there signs were up for quite some time.  Went in one evening for dessert and coffee.  Took a small table with leather lounge type chairs.  When our two crepes and coffee were delivered (order at the counter and they bring out to you) the plates were hanging off the table and had to be very careful not to knock coffee of the table.  Mind you there were 4 chairs around this table.  The plates were huge which was overly annoying and not well thought out.  The crepes themselves were actually quite thick, very large, and overly sweet for my taste.  One would definately have been enough for two people to share (especially as a dessert).  I wish they would have advised of this when we were ordering.  Suggestion would be to advise customers of the size or possibly offer a smaller portion option.  I also found the prices to be a little on the high side for dessert.  Our two dessert crepes and specialty coffees were about $25.  I do have to say that they add a chocolate covered strawberry to each dessert (not that you really need any more to eat) that is absolutely delicious.  I will most likely not visit again but if I do will be very mindful of the portion size and prices.

My son & I had Sunday brunch here on Sept. 21, 2014 & we enjoyed every delicious moment.  To compliment the great food, we also had excellent service provided by our server Nicole.  A very pleasant & attentive young lady who made sure our dining experience was more than just about the food.  So thank you Nicole for the exemplary customer service.

Went here on a Sunday afternoon and started out with a delicious Creme Brulee latte. (They torch the sugar on top. So good!) I ordered the Bruschetta crepe and my boyfriend ordered one of the more dessert-y crepes, so I got to try a little of both. Both exceeded expectations! If you want to go to a place with interesting, delicious food, I would totally check it out. Already trying to figure out how soon is too soon to go back!

seated right away but took awhile to get our water and latte..... 

was recommended the cookie butter latte and it is to die for. loved the cookie that came with it. 

ordered chefs omelette, strAwberry & banana  n nutella crepes   but there was probably a misunderstanding... no bananas in them but no problem. 

food is really great here but i agree on price- kinda a lil high but i will continue to come back. wished they open later :( great service too  . really a 4.5 stars

I really liked it! I went there on a Sunday morning to buy some crepes to go. I ordered 2 gluten free crepes for me and my husband. We had a really good time eating it, because it was delicious! The crepe with the side is a lot of food, so if you are not hungry I recommend to share. The next time I want to eat in the restaurant because the place is cool and the staff nice!

Top line: decent food, had a few quirks with service/layout.

Was surprised by this place, thought it would be a grab and go place, but it was a sit down place.  Waitress was super nice, but clearly didn't have much experience. 

Poor flow for the wait-staff, there was only one terminal, so there was perpetually a line. 

Weirdest part, they didn't have a hood over the cooking area so the whole place was kind of smokey. 

Bottom line: food was fine, but won't be back. If there were a few changes, might go back.

Today, I had the pleasure of stopping by for one of my most favorite crepes. CC makes a most satisfying buckwheat salmon, onion and goat cheese crepe. Once a "special" visitor on their menu, it resides as a regular on their permanent menu. A fresh pot of coffee was brewed for my meal as I arrived after the lunchtime rush. 
Service is always friendly and courteous.

I love everything that this brunch spot has to offer. We went with a group of 6 people and there was something on the menu for everyones cravings.

They have a variety of drinks to choose from (hot and cold). There were so many different speciality coffee drinks that I'll be sure to try the next time I visit. My boyfriend ordered the s'mores latte and got it iced. It came with marshmallows on top drizzled with chocolate and sprinkled with graham cracker. It was so good and I literally ended up stealing it from my boyfriend.

I liked that they had options for crepes - you could get sweet or savory. Perfect so that everyone can get what they are craving. I got the Herbed Ricotta Cheese and Spinach crepe. It had a ricotta and sun-dried tomato mixture inside with parmesan cheese, herbs, and fresh spinach with a roasted red pepper pesto on top. I ordered the potatoes as a side. It was such a good breakfast and I was not disappointed. The crepe was so big I was unable to finish the whole thing. My boyfriend got the chocolate peanut butter waffle which was also amazing.

Our server was great. She was personable and very nice. She offered us some suggestions and even told us some of her own favorites. We had a very good experience here.
Amazing food and great customer service! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! I've been to around 75 restaurants in Charlotte and these guys can roll with the best of them! Thanks!
Cute lil cafe atmosphere, service was pretty good, food was tasty, no complaints! I would definitely go again.

I ate at Crispy Crepe with my husband on a Friday evening and truly enjoyed the experience. Although our food took a little time getting to us it was worth the wait. We ordered the Pecorino chicken and Bruschetta crepes and split them between ourselves. We both had the little hummus with cilantro side. We really enjoyed our food!!  I can truly say it was better than I expected. This was my first time eating at a crepe place....my husband's second. He said he enjoyed his crepes at Crispy Crepe better than another place he'd tried. I also thought the meal was filling. Although my mouth was salivating at the dessert crepe that was being served at the table beside us, I was too full to order dessert. I am so glad we took a chance on a Groupon deal for this or we probably wouldn't have known it existed. The atmosphere was relaxing and consequently we were very comfortable and enjoyed the evening at Crispy Crepe immensely. We would definitely go back.

What a welcome surprise! I've driven by here a million times but never when I'm hungry... til today. I decided to grab a crepe before I hit Atherton Market on a Saturday at 11:00, and I thought I might be the only one in there. Wrong! It was hoppin'. Thankfully, there was one parking space left in the garage.

There were a few tables with umbrellas outside, but inside was nothing like I'd pictured - there were probably 10-15 tables with a big, open kitchen so you can watch them make the crepes, which looked like works of art. The wall had a cute mural of a cafe painted on it, and it definitely had a quaint, cafe vibe. I was by myself, but I didn't feel out of place at a two-top table, and my waitress, Liz, was awesome. 

I had a cup of coffee (strong and delicious at $2.89), and after much deliberation, I decided on the apple streusel crepe ($10.99). Mmmmm. It was almost too pretty to eat - almost - and it tasted as good as it looked. The apples were tart and warm, and the walnuts and streusel were crunchy; the dollop of creme fraiche cheese on top was a welcome addition. I also loved that the crepe was hearty - I've had some crepes that are so thin they fall apart when you eat them, but not this one. I especially appreciated the chocolate-dipped strawberry and whipped cream on the side... was that only a garnish? Nom nom nom.

-soggy rubbery crepe
-cheap oj, tastes like minute maid
-Potatoes gratin tastes cheap with a Mac n cheese flavor

I wanted something classic so I got the maple cream crepe with coffee and oj and a side of Potatoes. Maple syrup wasn't high quality. I won't be back.

I stumbled across Crispy Crepe on Yelp when looking for somewhere to take my husband for Father's Day.  I was hoping to find a place that had food options that my husband and children (ages 28-13) would enjoy.  We were all pleasantly pleased with our choices.  Some of us started with coffee or tea and they were all unbelievable!!  The presentation was beautiful but the taste and uniqueness was even better!!  Every one of us loved our food choices - from waffles, to crepes, to omelettes...you will not be disappointed!

Came here with my mom who was visiting charlotte for the weekend. Small but really nice place with a great atmosphere. I ordered the Chipotle chicken crepes, which were very good. The portions were decently large and the coffee was great as well!

Had brunch at this place on a Saturday. Cute little spot. The service wasn't stellar but it was OK. The waitress kept forgetting my glass of water. I ordered the Chocolate Nutella and Banana Crêpe. It was phenomenal.  Needless to say, can't go wrong with Nutella! Lol. The food was definitely satisfying.  My counterpart ordered the Hot Caramel Apple. The mug was almost overflowing with whipped cream, but was delicious! I will definitely return to try other crepes!

It was okay. We didn't realize that they close at 3, so when we came in we were informed that they would close in 15 minutes & they would only take Togo orders. So we were given a menu, and honestly I felt kind of rush to order because he kept staring me down ready to take my order any sec, it was kind of understandable though. I ordered 1 savory crepe, and 1 sweet crepe. I picked the smoked salmon & the apple streusel. The smoked salmon also came with potatoes they were pretty good! Very creamy. The salmon crepe however was soooo friggin' dry, I just got tired of eating it halfway though. The apple streusel crepe though, tasted weird to me. The apples were pretty sour, and it was so salty? Was it suppose to be that salty? I had waaay better crepes, I don't know if whether they were rushing that's why it wasn't that tasty, but I was pretty disappointed especially for the $$ I paid lol! The shop however was very cute/chic, I like how each table had its own little cute flower & the wall art was lovely. But I don't know if I would be back, maybe to try their lattes ?

Their prices are way to high for the way the food tastes.  I ordered the Belgium waffle and it tasted like wheat bread, not what I was expecting.  Also it was small.  The help is mediocre.  Definitely would not recommend this place to anyone.  Won't be coming here again.

Fantastic crepes. A lot of different kinds to choose from whether you're in the mood for savory or sweet. Really good coffee too. Might have to wait a little while to get a seat if you go on a weekend but not too long.

Best. Breakfast. I've. Ever. Had. 

This place is amazing! I got the cookie and cream crepes and they were phenomenal! Affordable and great service. I visited from out of town and now all I want is more crepes.

Crispy Crepe...can I take you back to California? By far one of the best breakfasts I have ever had!!! So good, I came twice in three days. Can't go wrong with the bacon, egg and cheese crepe...Delicious!!!! Lattes are spot on and they have a sugar free option. This place is bookmarked for my return.

I've been wanting to try out Crispy Crepe since it opened, and finally made it there yesterday.  First off, let me say that the service was great.  Our server was very friendly and offered several great suggestions.  

I started with the ham and cheddar crepe (not sure if that is the actual name).  It honestly tasted just like a ham and cheese hot pocket.  Although I really like those hot pockets, and the crepe was good, I probably wouldn't order it again.  I would rather buy the $2.00 hot pocket from HT than the $7.99 crepe.  My fiancee got the chipotle chicken flat bread and said it was very good.

We ended the night with the peanut butter chocolate crepe.  Do yourself a favor and get this crepe.  It was delicious.  It had melted peanut butter cups that just oozed out when you cut into it, and mixed with the chocolate drizzle.  It was served with some whipped cream that was just ok and a chocolate covered strawberry.  I honestly want another one right now.

So, overall a good experience.  I'm definitely going to go  back.  There menu us pretty big and several options looked tasty.  Be careful about sitting outside.  Although it was a nice spot, we were annoyed by numerous flies the entire meal.

First time here. Got an espresso, smoothie, strawberry and Nutella crepe, and bruschetta crepe. All was fabulous. The bruschetta had a good amount of cheese in it, which is always a plus. The au gratin potatoes were on point. Service was very slow and inattentive, to put it kindly. Got my own to go containers, cups, etc.

This was my first time to Crispy Crepe and I'm not sure how I feel about my experience. My feelings are a little mixed. To start, the place is in a great location, the atmosphere is nice, and all of the food looks really good. 

When my wife and I first walked in, it was very smoky inside. To the point it felt like I was in the kitchen the entire time. I even left smelling like I just worked a shift at the Waffle House. They even had to prop the doors open, but that did not help at all.

The staff was nice and very helpful. I just wasn't sure what to get as there were many options that looked appealing. I settled for the eggs, turkey bacon and waffle plate. It also came with a hash brown casserole scoop. The turkey bacon and eggs were good and so was the hash browns. The waffle on the other hand is part of why I docked a star. It was the most dense and thick waffle I have ever had. It was like eating a tough piece of bread. It was not fluffy or soft at all. It had a good flavor, but I could not stop saying to my wife how tough it was the entire time. I even had trouble cutting it with my knife at times. I'm not sure why this is the case but it's enough for me to never want a waffle there again. 

To make matters worse, if I wanted some of the toppings on my waffle, I would be charged an additional $4. Which is kind of ridiculous, being that I was already being charged $12 for the plate. There was also no option for anything other than the turkey bacon. My wife had a crepe and they charged her $3 extra to add the chicken on it. For the price that we paid, I expected to be blown away and I felt very let down. The price, the food and the smoke everywhere is why I'm giving them 3 stars. Many people there seemed to enjoy their food and I might have just ordered the wrong thing.

Delicous! I always get their specialty crepe - cookie butter. It's so addictive that I always tend to order same crepes whenever I'm here with my friends. I love their drinks also. S'MORES LATTE IS THE BEST!

Great place to come for brunch on a lazy Sunday
Service and food was good!
Would definitely come back for brunch
We were seated quickly on a Sunday afternoon. The service and food was great! We'd definitely return.
Marcia took great care of us! The cookie crepe was phenomenal and their soy lattes are killer.
Our new favorite crepe place in Charlotte! Loved this place! We had a savory and sweet crepe and both were delicious!!

Went here last weekend for a late lunch to sit outside with a friend. We split the Caesar Asparagus Salad and the Grilled Cheese Portabella mushroom sandwich which were really tasty! Definitely good quality products!  As others have said, the parking is a little hairy if you go at a busy time but there are normally spots in the parking deck behind the restaurant. 

Though our server was extremely sweet and informative, it seemed our food took longer than expected, especially since we were 1 of 2 tables there at the time (over 25 minutes).
If you're in a rush, this isn't the place for you. Definitely a place to sit back and relax. Absolutely willing to give it a go again though since the food was so delicious!

Happy eating!

Delicious! Had the cookie butter waffle, the onion soup, and herb chicken crepe (table shared the first two) Slam packed. It was fresh. Service was somewhat slow. 
I will definitely return.

An hour to get a soup and salad?? Everyone around us who has come in after us is finishing up and my food still isn't here.. Never again.. The waitress seems mad I'm asking where my food is... There are only about 5 tables including inside and out..

Great spot for breakfast brunch or lunch.
They have some really great crepe options with veggies and protein or you can go sweet. Like
Bananas and Carmel, apples or strawberries, you pick the combo or select from delicious options and you will be sure to be pleased.

They have waffles that are so rich and delicious. I don't recommend that as your meal. (Too heavy) But share one at your table. A few bites and you will be wondering where they have been all your life! 

Their specialty drinks are so good and their Salads at lunch are yummy too! 
I've never had a bad meal. 
Service varies, we've hit the jack pot a few times and often are left disappointed. 

They have indoor or outdoor seating and are conveniently located in south end. There's a parking deck down the alley behind the restaurant. 

If you haven't been try it out :)

I am hard on crepes, since I've been out of the states and have had them in International territory-where they basically live off crepes for their only diet.  I had a breakfast crepe and it was good, but the crepe itself seemed too dense-like a pancake, when in actuality, it should be quite light and fluffy-and served in a cone shape, not on a plate like an omelette.  The service was delightful and I would like to give them a try for a sweet crepe sometime.  If they blow my mind, I will revise my review. :)

Celiacs beware!! Today was our third visit. The first time was great, second time we ordered the same as the first time and to our disappointment it was nothing like the first time. Then, today, it was actually good, so this tells me of their inconsistency, however, that's not why I'm writing this review.  I am CELIAC (MUST have a Gluten Free diet) and for any of you aware of what that is, the MUST is non negotiable, apparently Crispy Crepe is ignorant of this and SHOULDN'T offer "gluten-free if they are not going to adhere to the claim or understand the effects of cross-contamination, etc. After such a lovely lunch with my family, I am now dealing with the ill effects of gluten contamination. Shame..

We stopped in just to see what the crepes were all about. I do wish that the staff could have help recommend things. 

The food is delish. The crepe I had was a double trouble with fruit, glazes, chocolate and whip cream.

It was my first time at the restaurant and the waitress did a great job on helping me decide on my choice.

Crispy Crepe is the cutest brunch place with its beautifully decorated decor of a French shoppe. The food too is beautiful and delicious, from its crepes to its waffles. There is a great variety of the type of crepes you can order, not only just for breakfast, but also savory lunch crepes and sweet desert crepes. My boyfriend and I found this place, and it became one of our top brunch restaurants in Charlotte.

Since Crispy Crepe is near my apartment complex, I was so excited for its opening. My first visit there was a late weekday. I ordered the Turkey Fontina sandwich, which was decent. Very average flavors despite its description. The "gourmet salad" was incredibly underwhelming. It consisted of chickpeas and some sparse feta vegetable-ish stuff. I ordered a croissant for the morning but they were out. To compensate, they included some chocolate strawberries. Nice touch! Definitely the highlight of the meal. Thank God that strawberry is in their logo. 

Ok, so the first meal 3/5 but then again... I didn't try their specialty. Armed for round two, I checked Yelp for recommendations. Despite some of the other reviews, I got myself a crepe for dinner tonight. Crispy Crepe? More like Chewy Crepe. You guys are right! The crepe was doughy, thick, and TOUGH. I couldn't bite into it, let alone cut it with a fork and knife. I ordered the Chocolate Chip Cannoli Crepes which called for ricotta filling and chocolate chips. Honestly, the filling felt cheap and almost offensive. The ricotta filling was thin and granular with no hint of ricotta. It was like they were trying to pull a fast one. I would have much rather walked across the street and gotten a real one from Nova's. The crepes came with a side of fruit in the same soupy creme. And my chocolate covered strawberry--the star of my previous meal--was partially mushy.

This sealed the deal. I wanted to like Crispy Crepe. I really did! The owner is such a nice man, and the staff is very accommodating. However, for a more expensive lunch joint, I need better quality and substance.

Came here on a Saturday morning with a large group. Bring your own wine so we went to cvs across the street.  ALL  the food was delicious and well plated. The place was packed with about 2 to 3 waiters. Great place to come on a date. I will definitely visit again. EVERYTHING was delicious.
Food here was a different concept from my usual outing but it was good. The gyro crepe was delicious and I would prefer the au gratin potatoes.

YUM YUM YUM!! The pictures shown are from our 4th visit to crispy crepe because the other times we've scarfed down the food so quickly. Shown are: Nutella and strawberry crepe, s'mores crepe, and cookies and cream. The drink is the cookie butter latte. Everything is to die for. We've gotten the savory crepes in the past and they're good but the sweet ones we can't get enough of.

I wanted to try one of everything! We started with hummus with toast and pita. I had the goat cheese, spinach and chicken crepe. It was huge and delicious. My friend had a very generous salad. I can't wait to go back & try the dessert crepes and coffees.
Go to crepe spot uptown. They have a huge array of coffees and breakfast foods but I don't know why you would come and not order a crepe or Belgium waffle. Definitely going back!

I used to love this place, but when I went yesterday it was so disappointing.  The coffee was gross AND lukewarm.  They only had individual non dairy creamers.  I mean, come on!  You're a breakfast place and you don't have half and half for coffee?  My eggs were so bland; the turkey bacon was actually grilled ham (or the softest "bacon" ever).  The waffle was ok but not nearly as good as it has been in the past.  I probably won't come back.  I spent $20 after tip and for that much money I could've had an AMAZING breakfast at Cafe Monte.

Have been here a few times and am always pleased! First time I got a savory crepe for lunch and a desert crepe to share with my friend. Today I got the shrimp and avocado salad which was delicious! It is nice to know they have more then just crepes here. My friend that came with me wanted breakfast and they had omelettes. The waitress was very sweet and on top of her game. If you want something different then the standard sandwich or salad lunch, give this place a try.
The Cinnamon waffle was very dense and not sweet, dry even with syrup. My wife had the gyro crape and was not impressed. Nothing was bad, just not very good. Coffee was above average

The workers are great, the prices are fair but the quality of the ingredients are extremely fresh and most of all DELICIOUS. I speak to everyone about this place: they all feel exactly like I do, Extremely satisfied. This is a must go to spot for all of those living in the southend area.

This is such a cute cafe.  Stop by and have a cup or coffee or grab a bite to eat.

 I had not heard a lot about this place besides what I read on Yelp but purchased a deal on Living Social to try it out. We stopped in the day before Valentines day so it was fairly slow. I had the Shrimp Crepe which was awesome. The outside was crispy though the inside that was wrapped around a ton of filling was a bit chewy as others have pointed out. I still loved my meal.  My boyfriend wanted to try the Shawarma and asked that it be made as a crepe. Just as others had found the chef had no issues accommodating this and he said it too was really good. I also had a Vanilla Cafe Latte which was so good. We sat around for a while after dinner chatting over our coffee.   I can't wait until it is warm enough to sit out on the patio.

I have been wanting to try this place since it opened, and buying the Groupon gave me just such an opportunity to do so.  Thus, my partner and I ventured here fairly early on a Saturday morning for breakfast.

Cookie Butter Latte:  Holy cow, this drink was flippin' awesome.  It was not too sweet, tasted very smooth, and I absolutely loved the cookies that came with it.  All the flavors came together well to produce a tasty drink.  I would come back here again just for this drink.  (5/5)

Americano:  Surprisingly, this was not as good as the latte.  I suppose when you add the milk and sweetness, you really don't get a lot of the coffee flavor.  By itself, the coffee was a little plain tasting and a little bitter.  (2/5)

Maple Delight Waffle:  When this came out, my first thought was that it was so small for the price.  However, when I cut into, I realized how dense the waffle was.  I suppose that's not surprising, since it's made from dough rather than a batter.  The flavor of the waffle itself was good, and I liked the thick yet soft texture of it.  The waffle itself was fairly sweet.  When you added the maple cream, whipped cream, and syrup, it was more like eating a dessert than eating a breakfast dish.  It was good, but a little too sweet and rich.  I could not finish it.  (3/5)

Egg and Bacon Cheddar Crepe:  I don't think I have ever had crepes this thin and crispy, which was definitely different.  The crepe itself was lighter in texture and less doughy than other ones I've had, and I really enjoyed that.  However, it had very little of the bacon in it and was mostly eggs.  That was a little disappointing.  The bacon that was in it was  good, though, and overall I did enjoy it.  For the price, though, the portions were not terribly big.  (3/5)

The staff was pretty friendly and efficient.  Our food came out quickly.  It's bright and cheery in there and I love the open design.  It's nice that they have decent parking in the garage and some street parking as well, but I am guessing there is an issue later in the evening when World of Beer starts filling up.

Overall, it was good, but without the Groupon, I don't know if I felt like everything was worth it.  I'd be willing to try it again.  Goodness knows I will likely come back here next time I'm craving that cookie butter latte.

I have eaten there many times and they are always cautious with my severe food allergies.  I would have given a 5 star but the service has been hit or miss by some of the waiters they bring in.  A couple have been amazing and then some don't belong around people at all.  They just don't have the charisma to wait on people.  But overall I'm happy with eating there and some of the best hummus I have had, too!

I'm s sucker for a crispy crêpe, and I've had many from different places.  While I wouldn't put the ones here at the top of the list, they are decent and I've enjoyed each of my visits.  I ope for the vegetarian crêpe, and I haven't been disappointed yet.  The au gratin potatoes are also a hit.  

Why not 5 stars?  Their coffee drinks could be a little better; I haven't been wowed yet, but I'll definitely go back.

I went to Crispy Crepe for the first time today. I have the Chipotle Chicken Crepe. It was delightful. I highly recommend the Au Gratin potatoes as a side. The only recommendation I would make to this establishment would be to carry ranch. A nice chipotle ranch would have been the perfect finishing touch! Other than that....a good find!

We went there with a living social we bought so I expected a crowd. After getting a seat we got in line and it took roughly ten minutes to order it seemed they did not have a grasp on how to run things smoothly. I was not told I had to get my own coffee so I waited until everything was brought out and then was told. Our food was not that great my gf got a Nutella banana and said it was over cooked and lacking In banana . I got a bacon cheddar egg and it had tons of cheese lousy turkey bacon and hardly any egg. So the food was not so good and the service and all around design was not great. I know they are new so we might give it another try in 6 months.

My husband and I adore this place. We have only eaten here twice but holy cow is it good. I have tried to make leige waffles as home many times with imported pearl sugar, and they're never half as good as Crispy Crepe's are. We both work in the restaurant industry and this place is great. I get the cookie butter waffle with bananas and whipped cream - pure heaven on a plate. We will continue to eat here as long as it stands. We always go on weeknights to avoid the crazy weekend crowd. Thank you for providing quality food!

How is it possible that this place is only 3.5 stars?! We go here every Sunday morning. We take our pups and sit outside. Everything serve ever had, which is pretty much everything, has been absolutely delicious! The specialty coffee are also insanely good.

Wanted a savory crepe so I ordered a sweet coffee drink - it worked out well.

YUMMM. The mocha latte is so delicious and creamy and not-too-sweet and just perfect. The savory crepe was awesome, too - chock-full of ingredients, loaded with avocado, and nicely seasoned chicken. Really hearty, huge, and so good.

Au gratin potatoes are to die for. I wish I could have a whole plate of those.

Had to wait about 25-30 minutes around 10:30am on a Sunday morning, but it was definitely worth it.

I ordered the cookie butter latte and the bonafie crepe. Both were delicious! My husband ordered the chipotle chicken crepe and I couldn't stop taking bites from his plate. 

Service is great as well, they are very fast. A great breakfast/brunch spot!
Bacon egg and cheese crêpe is amazing

Great crepes and fantastic artisan coffee!  The lunch menu looks fantastic and very nice cafe atmosphere.  Staff were very nice, service was great, and there is a really comfortable seating are with free wifi.  Can't wait to go back and try more especially since they are open early and stay open until 9 or 9:30 for dinner!

Crispy crepe catered one of my work breakfasts for a client.  The client was so happy.  They said it was the best breakfast any rep had ever done.  They will be my go to for client breakfasts in the future.

Just OK. My apple crepe was really dry. The potatoes needed salt. The latte drinks were very tasty, as were the chocolate strawberries. The worst part is the grease smell that my clothes absorbed and had to smell the rest of the day. Definitely overpriced. Probably won't be back.

Expensive, seems like portion wise they give you more for the savory crepes rather than sweet. The maple crunch crepe was pretty small, and heavy. Sole kind of cream looking thing inside of it that looks like ice cream. Not a very healthy option for sure but great if you have a sweet tooth. Not really worth $10.75 if you ask me, and not very filling.

The smoked salmon goat cheese egg crepe was surprisingly pretty good. Unfortunately the smoked salmon would have been better if they cook crepe first and then add it in to still keep the cold smoked texture, rather the salmon in the crepe is cooked. You get to choose a side with this crepe..some options were fruits(honey dew, sweet melon and pineapple slices), kettle chips etc

Pretty sparse for 10am but it started getting busy around 11. Overall i feel like there are better crepe places out there that are more economical. I am not a big fan of spending more than necessary just for the hype

Nothing hits the spot like crepes and this place is the bomb! Whether you're a savory person or sweet -- you'll have no problem finding a satisfiying crepe on their extensive menu. Personally.. I'm savory but most people I've dined with are sweet and, let me tell you, Crispy Crepe does not disappoint!  I had a chorizo and egg crepe the last time I dined here and it was so good! The person I was with got a sweet breakfast crepe and gobbled it up! The coffee was yummy too and they even gave me a to-go cup of Joe without me asking. I love this place! New addiction in Southend!

OMG Sweeeeeeeeeeeet Waffle!  Ate half because it was like having pie for breakfast.  Would definitely get this as a dessert & split it with my sweetie.  The waffle itself was delicious.  I would rather have had that with less creamy, gooey, carmel, sweetness first thing in the morning.  Serious Sugar Bomb.

The apple crepe was ok.  The crepe wasn't bad, but I didn't finish it.  The apples were small-chopped & when I tried to cut into the crepe for a bite, the apples just slid away or slid out.  I ended up just scooping out the apples/oatmeal/nuts & eating that & leaving most of the crepe untouched.

The hot chocolate & mocha were well-made & tasty.

I really wanted to like this place, they have a nice patio area, but for breakfast, it just didn't cut it.

I might have to go back & try a savory crepe, or get that waffle conglomeration for dessert one evening after dinner somewhere else.  

It's 3 stars just for that waffle.  Otherwise I'd have been at 2.5.

It's Sunday Brunch season and Crispy Crepe was our restaurant of choice. I ordered the Eggs and Turkey waffle platter with potatoes. The potatoes were the best thing on the plate. The waffle was dry, hard, and flavorless. The fact that you have to pay $2.99 for syrup is ridiculous so I had three bites and left the rest on my plate. I will say again the potatoes were wonderful! The service was subpar. Our waitress got all of our orders mixed up when the plates came so my eggs were on my cousins plate, her waffle was on a friend's plate, someone's turkey bacon was on her plate and someone else got a plate with absolutely nothing they ordered. So it took about three trips for everything to get fixed. The waitress was rude and stated " Well, usually when people order their food they know what they ordered and can tell us before the servers give them the plate". She brought the tickets at the end of the meal and had additional charges on my ticket for something that I didn't have. I am allergic to citrus so I am not able to drink orange juice. The fact that she added a charge of $2.99 for Orange Juice that would send me to the hospital if I drink it was outrageous. At no point did I have anything to drink other than water. Needless to say she did not get a tip because of her lacking service,  smart remarks, @and erroneous charges. I will certainly not be going back there for brunch. As a foodie,  this experience left me very disappointed on multiple levels.

What a mistake. I should have listened to the negative reviews on here.

We arrived on a Sunday morning, and after looking at the menu, we were unsure. The place looked fast-food and casual, but the prices were $11-12 for a crepe!

We were sat fairly quickly and went ahead and put in our order so we could eat quickly. First, the waiter screwed up our order and put the wrong thing in, and then told us 3 times that our food was almost out. It took 40 minutes for us to finally get our food after we ordered, and the manager even brought out the wrong side after they had already corrected my order once. We couldn't get the waiter's attention to get a straw so we got up and found one ourselves. 

Overall, the wait and the service was horrible. After expressing my concerns with the manager, he only told me that yes, that sounded frustrating and then brought me my food. Did not even bother to partially pay for my check.

I will never return here and never tell anyone to go here again. GO TO CAFE MONTE IN SOUTH PARK. I can not say this enough. The quality of the crepes are a million times better, and even though it's about $2 more expensive, the environment, quality, and service are a million times worth it.

This is a cute little get away for coffee or desserts, its great for a date or just going to hang out.  I had the apple streusel crepe and it was very delish, my friend had the cinnamon roll crepe and it was VERY sweet; almost like  cinnamon toast crunch cereal.  I do recommend this place for something fun and quaint and its very enjoyable.
Dessert for breakfast! so good. They also offer healthy gluten free options :)

Not dog friendly.  Owner was very rude.  Charged me $4 for a bowl my dog licked.  For some reason they can't clean dishes there.  Used to be a frequent customer but that's the last time I will dine there.

The response from "said g" should be posted somewhere in their restaurant.  Would've been much more cordial than extorting another $4 from a paying customer.
One of my favorite places in all of charlotte!! Went there before a panthers game and even tho it was busy, service was fast!

My daughter and I had to take the light rail up to South Blvd. to pick up some concert tickets from a radio station.  We were getting hungry and there were several restaurants to choose from.  This one just seemed to be right down our alley.  The funny thing is we didn't get a crepe; I got a salad and my daughter got the grilled cheese and portabella sandwich.  Both were delicious.  The dressing wasn't heavy-handed on the salad and the grilled shrimp were spiced just right.  The servers were attentive and it was small enough where we didn't have to scream at each other to have a decent conversation over the din of a lot of people.  Can't wait to have another reason to head back!

I've never been a crepe fan until eating here. There was no wait upon arrival. The menu is nice, with plenty to choose from...but not overwhelming. I had the chicken, goat cheese, and spinach crepe. It was nothing short of  delectable. The flavors were front and center in each bite. They are not stingy when it comes to filling the crepes, I had enough left over to take home for a small lunch. Our server was very patient with us and checked on us throughout our meal. I will be back!

I have been here twice since moving here in October and the first time i was blown away so maybe this second time just didn't live up the expectations i had set. The first time i got the Smoked Turkey with White Stilten Cranberry Cheese which was great. I do wish that there had been less caramelized onions on the sandwiches but it was all together great. The real star of that meal was my mom's Basil Grilled Chicken Sandwich. It was fantastic. We got this in October when she moved me into my apartment and seriously still talks about this sandwich like it was god's gift to earth. It was a great sandwich and i'd definitely get it next time i go in for lunch. The second time i went i got the Egg 'n' Turkey Bacon Waffle Platter with overeasy eggs and a side of the potatoes. The potatoes are good but very very cheesy. They were a bit much for me and i LOVE cheese. My eggs were runny which was really disappointing. The waffle was good but very dry. I felt that i needed to drench it in syrup to be completely happy with it. Both of my friends got crepes and loved their meals. I think that i've learned my lesson to stick with the crepes next time.

I have now eaten their twice. Both times I was extremely impressed both times. They luckily have the menu broken down by sweet and savory flavors of crepes. I have eaten one from eat and my daughter loves the cookies and creme one. My wife is also extremely impressed. I recommend this for anyone. Although if you plan to go with a group you will prob wait a long time. I recommend going during the week and going around 1pm. Not busy then.

I heard about this new crepes place in town and thought I'd check it out. I should have looked at reviews online before going. The ambiance is not what I expected. It kind of has a cheap feel to it once inside. Maybe it was the website and pictures that made me have higher expectations.

I ordered one of their specialties - the maple cream crepe. It was okay, but way overpriced at $10. My friend drinks coffee (I don't). She had to ask for another latte, because there were coffee grinds in her drink. When she got the new latte she said, "I think the coffee is just bad here." I didn't have any issues with the food taking a long time or it being crowded. There is another crepes place in NoDa (farther from me in South Charlotte) that I think is better. 

Bottom line: Sounds like it would be great, but very lackluster and not worth going.

First time here and I can't wait to come back and try something else. Loved the food, beverage options, but my favorite was the service. The girl was super kind, respectful, and great at her job. This is a direct representation of the management team. Great JOB! I can't wait to come back.

See my tip...I think the main concern is the parking. Don't be! It's in the back, INTO the garage which is absolutely free and safe.  HOMEMADE CREPES in EVERY order - and keep in mind, it's NOT small. It's pretty big crepe, even when it's folded. Defy thumbs up!! CUTE place to dine... I will return for breakfast one day SOON! ...and the price? Really? Can you actually find a fault with this???

My absolute favorite get away!!!!! You have to try this place if you haven't already. Breakfast & lunch are both delicious. Desert is to die for and the staff is more than friendly. My daughter and I are regular visitors here. Cozy cute place. You can eat inside and outside.

Ok let me start by saying it was a living social coupon that got me in the door but i would be happy to return and pay regular price.  I saw the coupon and I checked yelp which i am prone to do and I saw the mixed reviews so I said what the heck i have a coupon if its horrible i don't have to go back.  Well me and my girlfriend were very happy we decided to give it a try. 

 I can only speak from my one experience but it was top notch.  We went around 2:30pm on a tuesday, there were about  2 or 3 other parties seated and it was not busy at all so we were seated immediately.  I ordered the smores latte and my girlfriend ordered the cookie butter latte, i am not much for warm drinks other than hot chocolate but i just wanted to try this and its was very very good.  My girlfriend is a coffee and espresso lover and she said she would come back just for these latte's in the future.  Waitress who was named jesse also brought us some waters without us asking which was very nice.  She did a very good job throughout our experience checking on us. 

For our entrees I chose the chipotle chicken crepe and my girlfriend had the Mediterranean chicken crepe.  They were both exceptional and i am a picky eater to say the least, i would order either again.  I am not a crepe connoisseur so i can't speak for authenticity or anything else but i know good tasting food and this was it.  Portions were large we both had enough to take home and basically have a whole second meal later.  I could have finished mine but wanted to try a waffle for dessert.  The au gratin potatoes were similar to a hashbrown casserole, i added some siracha to mine and enjoyed them, my girlfriend said hers were good also and enjoyed hers plain.  

For dessert we tried the cookie butter waffle, their "liege" style waffles with bananas whipped cream and this cookie butter stuff, it was sweet and decadent and very good. It is not gonna be a hot crispy and fluffy waffle so don't expect that or you will be disappointed, it is more dense and chewy but that is the way its suppose to be according to them and it was fine with me just know what your getting before you order it.    

I don't leave reviews everywhere i go but this was a place that had mixed reviews and i was on the fence about trying but I'm very happy I did and we will go back for sure.  I can't comment on busy weekends or anything else but this tuesday afternoon was a pure delight!

Our food was good, but the service is painfully slow. It took 20 minutes after being seated before the waitress even took our food order, and then an additional half hour before the food made it to the table. I realize it isn't fast food, but that's just painful and not worth the wait.
Love this place, but the decor could use some work. Crepes are the size of your head and are divine.

My boyfriend and I went around noon on a Sunday. It was a nice amount of ppl there, but we were able to get a table right away. I ordered the Cookie Butter Crepe w/strawberries and it was delish!!!! We sat right next to the grill and I thought that was pretty neat. Can't wait to go back.

The food has become inconsistent. I had to send my disgusting egg and veggie crepe back. Do you know she charged me for the fruit that came with the crepe, regardless  I ordered another crepe. That was the Mediterranean. I have been here before and had this same crepe and this time it was nasty. The shrimp were cold and unseasoned. The spinach was flavorless and barely warmed. It was dry. The sauce was scarce. Even the freaking side salad was terrible. As if all this was not enough, I asked for another cup of hot tea and she said, "I can bring you some water, but I have to charge you for another tea bag." WHAT!!!! Hell no!

Great food, but don't come here with more than four people. You will never get seated. Management wouldn't let the hostess put two four seat tables together for us, but they will seat two people in those tables instead of them sitting on the open two seat tables and make groups larger than four wait indefinitely. We only had six in our group and we weren't sure if we would ever get seated.

Other than that, great food and good service.

Was visiting a friend in Charlotte and she took me to this place. I ordered some bruschetta crepe with cilantro jalapeno and pita chips, it was pretty good! But it was a few months back and I dont exactly remember loving it. I also ordered an iced chai latte..it was ok, I've had better.

I have to update my review. I still love the food here but this place has become so unreliable. I have had bad experiences the last two times I came. I tried placing a pick up order about 15 minutes before close last time. Called about 5 times with no answer. Arrived 8 minutes before close and two men said that they already closed for the day. I questioned them about the posted closing times to which they responded that it was a few minutes before close and they were done for the day. I told them I had been trying to call in a pick order with no answer and they were just like "oh." Then this current time they were out of waffles by 11am...


Original Review:::
Love this place. The European waffles are just like the gofres in Spain! The Shwarma Lamb pita is a force to be reckoned with. Great for brunch and regular lunch. Haven't had a bad meal here yet. So glad this place exists here in Charlotte.

This place is okay. We didn't wait long for a table but we did wait to get our drink order taken, and then about 20 minutes for our food, which was one crepe and one cinnamon waffle. Our waitress was busy I guess because she didn't seem to check on us often, and she didn't really speak up which she needed to do because that place is loud. 

I got my waffle and wanted a steak knife to cut through it. I remember going to a waffle place that had waffles like these before, and they were done in 5 minutes and I didn't need a sharp knife to cut through them. So this waffle wasn't my favorite waffle. On my list of favorite waffles it comes in right under that weird store brand frozen waffle I bought one time because there was a picture of a meadow on the box. In retrospect what does a meadow have to do with waffles? I don't know. 

My friend didn't like the coffee but my frozen mocha smoothie was pretty alright. He got a gyro crepe and said it was basically a salad stuffed into a crepe. The potatoes au gratin were pretty good though. 

One thing I didn't like was the lack of sides you could order. I figure you can order sides, but it would have been nice to see what was available instead of having to rely on the soft spoken waitress who I could not hear.

I live over 40 minutes away so was not very happy when I arrived and discovered they decided to close an hour early. 
This is not the first time they've done this and it's very annoying. I won't be coming back and will give my money to another business that wants it more. 
This is not very good business practice and feel like they're letting teenagers run this place.
Such a yummy breakfast spot - you can bring dogs and sit outside, gets busy of the weekends but they turn tables fairly fast and food comes fairly quick.  Great lattes too!

This place is ok, but I don't know that I will be rushing back.  I had the egg and veggie cheddar crepe.  I really liked it but i agree with the other reviews that they are more rubbery crepes than crispy.  My wife had the waffle, egg, and turkey bacon platter.  The waffle was extremely dense.  We couldn't tell if it was under cooked or if that was how it was intended.  The flavor reminded me of a soft pretzel dough...kind of.  All in all..not bad...not great...but with so many unique items on the menu we will probably give it another try one of these days.

Great way to start an late Saturday morning. 

Came here with a buddy after a round of golf and this place hit the spot. It was busy, but took really long to get seated--about thirty minutes.  Given the simplicity of preparing the crepes, the rose itself took a long time to get to us.  Server was very detailed and repeated our order but still got the sides wrong--mine on buddy's plate and vice versa. She was nice so I can't knock her for that.  The crepes themselves were tasty an very filling.  The berry shake though, is where it's at!

Still coming back here bc the shake was so good... Did I tell you how good the shake is here?

dmo out.

Crispy Crepe... What to say about this place.. i feel like a kid in a candy shop.. Everything here is well done, even the coffee is some of the best Ive had.

See you guys soon

It wasn't bad, but I wasn't impressed. There was more crepe than filling, no distinct flavors everything tasted monotone. I didn't like the setup of the dining floor, felt like they grouped certain crowds together.  The Belgian Waffle had so much whipped topping and caramel you couldn't taste the waffle.  We've had better.

My husband and I have been to Crispy Crepe a handful of times now, and I do like them very much (with the exception of their specialty coffees).

We've only been here for breakfast, and I like that they open early on weekends.  They also have a barista and offer a variety of specialty coffee drinks, but I'll warn you that the syrup-flavored drinks are OVERLY sweet.  The chai latte I had one time was honestly so sickly sweet I couldn't drink more than the first sip.  The server could tell I wasn't drinking it, but never asked if anything was wrong.  Boo.  I'm much happier just getting a cappuccino or latte since that occurred.

Crispy Crepe will modify any crepe you choose with more or fewer fillings.  I like getting their egg, bacon, and cheese crepe, but placing the turkey bacon on the side (for my husband), and then adding avocado and chipotle crema.  Wow, that's an awesome combination!  And their crepes are FILLED.

My husband has been more adventurous, trying several of the sweet crepe varieties, as well as their avocado BLT.  He's liked everything he's had so far.

Their sides are very good.  We've tried their salad, as gratin potatoes, and fruit.  The salad is really delicious and my favorite, topped with their homemade creamy vinaigrette (with basil?).  Their at gratin potatoes are good, but are never served hot enough, temperature-wise.  We've sent them back a couple of times for reheating.  The fruit is best in summer.

Service is usually very fast.  And they have a lot of outdoor seating covered by umbrellas, so it's nice sitting outside in both summer and winter.

All in all, we recommend Crispy Crepe.  Just beware of the specialty coffees if you don't like your drinks very sweet.

*shrugs* I thought it was pretty good.  I know nothing of crepes, so I couldn't tell ya the difference between a good one and a not so good one.  Mine was tasty.  I ordered the egg and veggie crepe and Hubs ordered a bacon and ham one.  Both were good and not too soggy.  I think crepe's are supposed to be thinner so that would be my only complaint.  Service was really friendly and the place is really clean. Oh and my dish came with a side of either fruit or Jasmin rice.  I opted for the rice.  I thought it was going to be hot in temp but they served it COLD.  It shocked my taste buds for a sec, but it's really good.  You would think it to be warm! so that was a nice surprise.  
 Again...*shrugs* I liked it and will go back.  I won't make a special trip, but I'll at least go again if I'm in the area.  :-)

Oh my word super yummy.. some reviews say its pricey but  I found it was fine for the amount of/quality of food  and Service was great. We will definitely be back and just F.Y.I I don't eat Lamb but the hubby got the Shawarma Lamb.... He has not stop talking it about!!!! Ohhhhhhh and get the the potatoes.... yummy... I had a crêpe with bacon egg and cheese its turkey bacon which was good and a latte with cookie butter and it was super yummy, make sure you stir it because the goodness is at the bottom.

Just had Take out.... it was still yummy this time had Chicken Shawarma!!!!! My new favorite sandwich!!! I was happy!!! Will be back soon!!! Thank yet again!!!!

I've lived in the neighborhood for several months but had the pleasure of trying this place for the first time this weekend for breakfast. I enjoyed the eggs and waffle plate with turkey bacon and potatoes. I had the Hazlenut waffle which was a delicious mix of Nutella, fresh strawberries and whipped cream. Needless to say it was heavenly and just writing this review is making me crave that perfection. Service wasn't anything too special, but it wasn't terrible either. I will definitely be back again!

I wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I hoped it'd be better than it was.  The entire restaurant was very smoky inside and I couldn't breathe well.  My food was average, but made my stomach hurt later!!! I might give it another try sometime. The service was decent.  The prices were ok too.

A hot date chose this place for Sunday brunch and I am SO glad that he did! We arrived around 2 on a Sunday and there was no line, so we were seated immediately. Our waitress, Aubrey, was patient as it was my first time here and it took awhile to review the menu. I had the strawberry and nutella crepe and my date had the shrimp and pesto crepe. My crepe was delicious. It's supposed to be more of a dessert option, but so be it. The strawberries were fresh and plentiful. Couldn't ask for more. I was able to taste my date's crepe and it was extremely good too. Think I'll have it the next time I go, as I will certainly be returning soon.
Excellent food gorgeous atmostphere incredibly delicious. Love this place reasonable prices for a highly recommended food.

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!  We got the turkey bacon, cheese, avocado, & mushroom crepe...my husband loved it.  Also, we got the veggie & added shrimp, it was great!  The side salad and potatoes au gratin as our sides.  The hazelnut latte & micha were amazing.  Great spot for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or just coffee and dessert.

Oh my goodness!  I had a late breakfast here today and I can say, without a doubt, that I will be back.  I ordered the Cookie Butter Waffle and a side of the Au Gratin potatoes.  The Cookie Butter Waffle was garnished with bananas, whipped cream, and a delicious Biscoff cookie (I'm a Flight Attendant, so I know all about the Biscoff).  Very sweet, but I didn't expect anything else.  And the potatoes were absolutely delicious too!  Since it was a weekday afternoon, the place wasn't busy, which I appreciated.  My server was very sweet and attentive.  I can't wait to return and try their lattes!

This was a great little find. (thanks to yelp)

These folks specialize in crepes and waffles. I have fallen in love with the Maple waffle, YUM!

The food portions are about right and the choices on the menu are all quite health when you thing about it. 

Dexter and I love this place because they have a nice outdoor seating that is far enough away from the road.

They do a great job at recognizing you when you come back.

After talking with the wait staff and chefs, these guys are always on the look out for new menu items to add and improve their menu.

We've driven by this place a few times and mentioned wanting to go, so this Sunday we made it happen. There was a little bit of wait but it wasn't too long. We sat down and were immediately greeted. I ordered the cookie butter latte with soy milk and my boyfriend ordered a caramel macchiato. Mine was delicious. He didn't like his at all but the waitress happily offered another drink instead. He ordered the smores latte and liked it much better. 

For our meals, he had the waffle, eggs and turkey bacon. He really liked it, especially the potatoes. I had the veggie crepe with cheddar cheese instead of goat cheese (and no hummus). Now, when I ordered it, I had a ton of hesitation just because it is unlike things I normally order. However, I was blown away! The garlic oil drizzled on top was amazing. My boyfriend also really liked it, which says a lot because he typically likes meals full of meat. The only thing that was just ok to me were the potatoes. Now, again my boyfriend really liked them. I thought they were tasty, but I wish they were served at a warmer temperature. 

Overall, it was really good. We will return.

Overall not likely to be returning - service, food and comfort left something to be desired. If you read some of my other reviews you'll find I usually will give props where due

Service - greeted at the door and handed menus before being seated; 5-10 minutes before server comes to the table (host did check and follow up) then another 5-10 for water

Food - over seasoned and kind of disappointing because the buckwheat crepe was quite tasty; my herbed goat cheese/chicken/spinach crepe was over seasoned with herbs; other half's apple and Brie with onion marmalade was mostly cinnamon apples with 5-6 small pieces of Brie he barely found and strings of cooked onion (definitely not a marmalade) - there were so many apples it should have been a dessert crepe.

Comfort - not sure if the AC wasn't working or it got too hot; the front door was open and the restaurant was a little warm as a result

I have visited Crispy Crepe two times so far and enjoyed both. It's not a very large restaurant so seating could be an issue during peak times.  With that being said, they are only open for breakfast and lunch, no dinner!  

Since everything is freshly made to order, be patient with the amount of time it takes for your food to come out.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I wish they were open later and the prices aren't low, but I understand it's because of the quality that is put into it... I do appreciate a good crepe though!

They do offer gluten free crepes for those who prefer it.

This place is sooo yummy! I got the brushetta crepe, and it was out of this world amazing. One of my friends got the Nutella crepe with strawberries which was of course amazing as well. They also give you a ton of food! Highly recommend!

Love the patio seating it's small but intimate. 
Fun fact: there's no alcohol sold here due to owner's decision BUT you can bring outside champagne and other a $10 pitcher of OJ and they'll bring you champagne glasses. There's a CVS across the street that's we did. I had the chipotle chicken savory crepe with potatoes yum! Also tried the hummus and bruschetta flat bread which I definitely recommend getting.Cassie was our waitress she's was patient we had a needy group lol . Definitely recommend and will be back!!

My mouth waters just thinking about the strawberry and nutella crepe at Crispy Crepe! The parking deck is a bummer and there may be a short wait, but it is worth it! They have a variety of savory and sweet crepes and I've never been disappointed, though the strawberry and nutella is so good that it is hard to try something new!

This is a place that you drive by and say I'll go there one day and then never do.. Because who doesn't like crepes? Well I'm telling you to give it a shot! I went once and got hooked! They have amazing hot drinks including a cookie butter latte. They have great breakfast crepes and most certainly wonderful dessert crepes. Before arriving I was already a huge fan of cookie butter and to see all the cookie butter inspired entrees I was in heaven! 

They have both inside and outside seating available. The restaurant is not the largest so seating is a little cramped if you are 5 people. If you go on a weekend there will probably be a little wait time but it's worth it. You're in SouthEnd so enjoy the neighborhood :) 

The wait staff was very helpful specially if it is your first time! They provided helpful hints and also offered us to go drinks on the way out! We will be back soon!

Holy good crepe!  This place is pretty freakin good.

It's tucked in a little corner off of S. Blvd and is not that noticeable from the street.  I wouldn't have randomly stopped by here and only knew of this place because some coworkers told me about it.  

Crispy Crepe has a good amount of tables, and also have some couches, but I would recommend sitting at the tables so it would be easier to eat.  I thought it was great that the tables all had a touch of a real flower in a small vase.  Made it feel nice inside.

Their menu has different variety, but not too much to overwhelm you with what you should choose.  I decided to get the Mediterranean Chicken, and man o man did I make the right choice!  The food was good, and not at a bad price either.  I'm sure I could have watched them make my food as they have a big glass where you can view them making the crepes, but I wanted to score a seat at a table before it started getting too busy.

The only reason this place lost a star is because with their parking, I had to park at a meter and parallel parking is not my forte.  I plan on going back one day and getting a dessert crepe to fulfill my sweet tooth needs.
Crepes are absolutely on point and the coffee is simply phenomenal. One of the best creperies we've been to in a LONG time. If you're in the area definitely stop in.

The food was good. We went with another couple and tried several dishes. The staff were friendly as well. Why I'm giving this a two is because there was so much smoke in this little quaint restaurant that our eyes were burning and watering throughout the whole meal. We actually rushed through our meal so that we could leave. Due to the smoke we smelled like food all day. There definitely needs to be better ventilation. Especially because the place is small.

Went on a sunny day and sat outside. Ordered chipotle chicken and salmon, egg and goat cheese crepes. Both crepes were big portion. Both crepes were okay. The crepe dough was little thick to me though. Also wish there were more cream on the top of the crepes. The side dishes that came with potato with cheese and fresh salad. Potato was good and salad was fresh. The server was attentive and the food was good but not a wow-level. 3 and a half star for this experience!

I'm surprised the rating isn't higher, this place was fantastic! I had the Cookie Butter Latte, which was divine, and the S'mores N More crepe. My crepe was delicious. It's a good thing we were just visiting Charlotte because I could myself eating there way too often if I lived nearby :).

I survived college partially on a diet of strawberry-nutella crepes, so I wanted to give this place a shot. I went for Brunch by myself on a Sunday and it was a pretty mixed bag. I might have been more forgiving if they opened pretty recently...?

Pros:
1. I snagged a spot in the garage behind the building - there are some reserved spots for this restaurant specifically, for one hour.
2. I immediately got seated outside, and when the sun came out (and some other people left) they indulged my request to move to another table under 1 of their 2 umbrellas.
3. Due to their slow service, they brought me a side of fruit and didn't charge me for my tea (I happened to notice it on my check, they didn't point it out to me). 
4. I had the Apple Streusel Crêpes and it was DELICIOUS. Seriously. The chocolate covered strawberry was a bonus, but I housed that whole freaking thing. It was a meal in & of itself.

Cons:
1. I sat for 10+ minutes before I was approached by a waitress. My entire meal (1 savory crepe for 1 person + iced tea) took 1.5 hours.  I don't know if they're not used to having an outside section since it's been rainy? I assume they're the same level of busy every Sunday.
2. My waitress, Ariel, was not at all friendly. I wouldn't go as far as rude, and I would love to make an excuse for her as it seemed hectic, but I never got told the specials, had to ask for tea refills, and generally felt like I was putting her out somehow.

Overall, I would go back to explore more of their menu, but probably not sitting outside (which sucks, I love to bring my dog and eat outside).
I have heard a few other comments from friends (which put the craving in my head!) that some of the menu items are definitely misses.  Mine was hit so it gets 3 stars!

I came here for the first time and set quite the first impression! I ordered the Pecorino Chicken and my sisters ordered the Bruschetta and the Bacon Egg and Cheddar. These three crepes were awesome! The size of these were larger than your traditional crepes. I would definitely come back and I would definitely refer people here! This place was great!

Yummy waffles and other goods including smoothies and of course, the namesake crêpes. The interior is sleek and yet very welcoming and the service is prompt. I ordered a banana butterscotch (I think it was) waffle to dine in and also a smoothie to go, and the waffle came out promptly whereas, per my instuctions, the smoothie was ready when I was ready to leave the restaurant myself. I think they have a variety of salads and other lunch goodies on the menu, but the waffles are something else. More like a dessert nearly than a proper breakfast, and certainly not something the cardiologist will approve of, but very very very yummy. 

And sometimes that's exactly all that really matters.

Didn't love it, didn't hate it.  I truly want to support this place and give them credit for their efforts.  We tried the tomato, basil and mozzarella crepe and added chicken.  It came with a generous-sized side item.  It was good.  I've had crepes where they are crunchy but this was more soggy and it required a fork.  It was like a big, greasy, doughy mess by the time I was half way in.  Just not the best in my opinion.

I didn't try any of the sweet crepes but they had quite a selection and a couple of them seem worth a 2nd try.  I won't hoof it over here again just to visit crispy crepe but if I'm in the area I am not opposed to giving them another shot.

Sweet and savory crepes. Best of both worlds. Not huge selection but they do have a decent variety. A bit on the pricey side, but the quality and filling for almost all their items are premium.

Also, you can see them make your crepe (which I always find entertaining)

5/9/2013-  Terrible Service and food!
We had the waitress who wore the hot pink lipstick.  After we were seated took hot pink, 25 minutes to come back to take our order.  I ordered the grilled marinated shrimp-just ok.  My husband ordered the lamb sandwich, next remove the fat and use more meat and the flatbread was stale.  This was not worth the one hour and twenty minutes.  We will never come back again and would not recommend the to anyone.   You are over rated.  Yuck! 
PS the free Thursday crepe dessert (apple streusel) was never served to us as ordered.

I have loved this place since they opened. My husband and I now consider ourselves crepe connoisseurs and go places in search of the best crepe! They have an array of sweet and savory delights to choose from, and I have never been disappointed!  I've had the Pecorino Chicken, the Apple Streusel Crepe, and the Chocolate Chip Cannoli and all three are delicious! The crepes taste delicate and the ingredients are very fresh!

Delicious. Kind customer service. Clean. Fast service. Delicious latte. Best I've ever had. So much food, I couldn't eat it all. The herb chicken and goat cheese is yummmm. The savory crepe is so flavorful. I will definitely be back.

I was so excited to try Crispy Crepe, however, I was so disappointed!!!!  I asked the server for recommendations, and i ordered her suggestion.  My entire family ordered so we had 5 crepes.  When I got my crepe, I thought it was terrible.  I told the server I didn't like the crepe, and she offered to get me something else.  Little did I know, I was being charged 1/2 for the crepe I sent back and full price for the replacement crepe - I was NOT informed of this when I placed another order.  I received my bill as I was starting to eat my second crepe as my entire family was finished with their food.  Once I saw the charge, I sent the other crepe back with only 2 bites taken and told them I would pay for none of them.  The manager stated she was sorry I was not told about paying for both crepes, but she didn't remove them from the bill.  Basically, I was being charged for 1.5 crepes and I took 3 bites total.  The second crepe was actually very good, but I sent it back on the principal that I should only have to pay for 1 crepe especially when I was not satisfied with the first one and the server was the one who recommended the crepe that was horrible.  After arguing, the manager removed both items from my bill.  I left the restaurant hungry and very unhappy.  I will never come back.   I have never heard of a restaurant trying to charge people for bad food that is sent back - it tells me that they don't stand behind their food which is crazy since that is their business.  Do not go to the Crispy Crepe!!!!!

We have been here three times now and we have enjoyed each visit very much. The service is great and it is easy to find parking. We usual get one savory and one sweet crepe to split which is perfect. Love all of their crepes with eggs and the buckwheat crepes are really good and a great option if you are looking for something on the health side. We haven't tried any of their waffles but they look awesome.

We enjoyed our brunch this Sunday. Arriving right in the middle of the rush, it was a surprisingly short wait. The tables turn over quickly here!

Even though they have tons of other stuff - sandwiches, waffles, salads - there are two pages of crepes on the menu - one of savories and one of sweets. Tough to choose!

After our waiter brought us two swimming pool sized cups of coffee, we chose one sweet crepe (the Apple Streusel) and one savory (the Crispy, which is cheese stuffed). Both took a little bit to be prepared, during which the coffee was refilled. Good coffee, btw. Even though they have lattes and cappuccinos and other 'elite' coffees, you can't go wrong with a cup of Joe here.

Both plates arrived looking excellent as you can see from the pictures. The apple crepe was massive and quite sweet. The "Crispy crepe" was excellent. Tons of cheese and lots of flavor. I think I made out better for having that one. Oh, and the side of potatoes? Heavenly!

Plenty of parking in the parking deck behind the restaurant or on the street if you can find it.

One of the best breakfast places that I have been to in Charlotte. The crepes are huge and delicious! My friend got a savory crepe and I got a Mediterranean crepe which was amazing! We had a large party. We  just left a 5k walk and were starving. We were taken care of quickly. The server was great... Bottom line, I will be returning to this place again...

I thought the food here was really good. The menu is quite extensive, so it took me a while to decide (who doesn't love crepes?) The waiter suggested the bruschetta crepe, and it didn't disappoint. I also got a creme brûlée late which was completely delicious! I didn't give myself enough time to enjoy this, since I arrived an hour before they were closing.

I wanted to try a sweet crepe, but it was way too much food. I'll have to go back even though a "pick two" or "half-and-half" option would be amazing.

The setting was okay. It is nicely decorated, but the vibe is lacking. I went later in the day, so it may be different during the peak brunch time.

I visited this restaurant today with a friend who had been wanting to go. I had never heard of this restaurant, but I was open to trying something new. We split three meals: a cookie butter waffle, the smoked salmon crepe w/fruit, and a cheese omelet w/ potatoes. We were greeted by a male waiter. He asked us if we were ready to order even though we had just gotten there. Since we'd never been there he took our drink orders and left. He brought me a sweet tea that looked like cloudy apple juice. It tasted like it was old. And again he asked if we were ready to order even though much time hadn't passed. We told him we weren't ready to order and he tried to rush us by asking if we wanted to know his favorites. But I didn't ask for his input. I wanted to continue to look. But he offered his opinion, and we quickly decided on those 3 items. He went to put the order in and we didn't see him again till the food came.
