I informed him that the tea wasn't good and instead of saying "I'm sorry about that, let me get you something else," he told me "Oh yeah it did look kinda weird when I brought it." So we got out food. The cheese omelet was good, not hard to mess up. The potatoes reminded me of mashed potatoes though. The salmon crepe was not as creamy as I expected, which is what I expected from an entree with goat cheese. The eggs and salmon in the crepe were both over cooked. The cookie butter waffle was really good. It would have been better if my drink had been refilled because it was very sweet, but my waiter was outside socializing while I went without  he finally refilled it, but I was ready to leave and my friend was too. She waiter gave us our checks, picked them up AND asked us if we needed change. Uhhhh...YES I DO I WAS THIRSTY WHILE YOU WENT OUTSIDE AND THEN CAME BACK IN AND STOOD IN THE KITCHEN DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM MY TABLE AND LAUGHED AND TALKED. I work hard for my $ and I truly want it back. Such a damper in a beautiful day.
Great and huge crepe! I ordered ahead and took out, so no idea about the wait/atmospher of the resteraunt, but the food was nice and the homemade chips good and crispy as well!

3.5 stars

We came here with a groupon yesterday for lunch. We were quickly seated and given waters right away. Everything looked good so I went with the chipotle chicken while the bf ordered the Mediterranean chicken crepe. Crepes are a little over 10 bucks here, kinda pricey. Crepes came out fast and wow, they are big. We should have split one. The Au gratin side was Delish! I was disappointed to find the chipotle chicken was very bland. I didn't even get a hint of chipotle. But, everything was fresh! The Mediterranean chicken was so bomb though! The sauce included in this is so flavorful! Some chicken pieces felt off and a little chewy. Had to box up both crepes, they were so big we couldn't finish! 

We will be back for more, but, well be splitting a savory and getting a sweet. The cookie butter sounded enticing. Having a crepe to yourself is just too much food. Cheers!

Great brunch spot! I ordered the Herb Ricotta Cheese and Spinach crepe and had no regrets. The vibe is laidback and cheerful, and service was awesome. Lots of coffee options too. If you're super hungry and debating whether it's worth a 30 minute wait for brunch, it is.

Also, they were great about accommodating shellfish allergies.
Didn't get any crepes based on the 45-minute wait, but our food ended up taking around 30-minutes regardless. Has the turkey bacon/egg croissant and a waffle platter. Seating was pretty limited.

Crispy Crepe is in the heart of the South End (one of my favorite areas in Charlotte) and I am a sucker for outdoor seating.  My bestie and I thought we'd try something new so Crispy Crepe it was.  I was really excited after reviewing the menu, but I couldn't decide if I wanted sweet or savory so I ordered the Smoked salmon, egg and herb goat cheese Crepe and my friend ordered the Cookie Butter Waffle and we split each dish to satisfy our palette.  The food was delicious HOWEVER the service was not the best.  We chose to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. The waitress was prompt in coming to our table, explaining the menu and the food arrived to our table in a timely manner.  Towards the end of our meal, another waitress arrives to our table and aggressively says "So are you guys ready for your check or what?"  I was a little taken back by her tone and the fact that she was coming to our table without announcing why she was coming to our table at all.  It gave me the impression that she was rushing us and not to mention she was rude.  I guess my expression said everything because she quickly corrected herself explaining that our waitress was occupied and sent her over to ask if we were ready for our checks.  I think it's important to teach your staff the importance of tone and delivery.  It's not what you say but how you say it.  That one incident partially spoiled my overall brunch experience...nevertheless the food was good and I still recommend trying Crispy Crepes.

A coworker of mine told me to check out this place and I will definitely be going back. I went with a friend and we got two crepes. One was the goat cheese and chicken crepe and the other was the chipotle chicken. The goat cheese was my favorite crepe. I was nervous about it possibly being dry but it has just the right about of goat cheese. The chipotle chicken was good but had a lot going on inside the crepe. After a few bites I ended up picking just the chicken out because it was too much

2.5 stars here.  It's not terrible, but the value just isn't there. I gave this place two tries and I was really excited for it opening, but I was not really impressed with it.

I am not a crepe connoisseur, but the crepes were very doughy and heavy, rather than thin.  Also, there was not much flavor to the breakfast crepe I had.

After trying the crepe, I tried their Liege waffle.  Unfortunately, that too was very doughy and left me not feeling that well.  (I did enjoy the bonus chocolate covered strawberry, though)

The #1 downside of this place are their high PRICES.  I would not mind the food being mediocre, but the prices are very high for the quality you get.  I think I am done with this place for now until someone persuades me to return.

For now, if I want crepes, I will keep going back to Hazelnuts Creperie.

Just the Best!!

Food is scrumptious and savory, the coffee is heavenly & the service is outstanding! There is tons of options, from breakfast to sandwich style to desserts. They have an outdoor patio too!

Our server Joe F. was always checking on us, making sure we were happy, comfortable and well taken care of - go Joe!

I had a waffle there and it was good, but what I really didn't like that ventilation inside was very bad. As soon as I entered the restaurant there was a smog in the air, after sitting inside for a half an hour I stank. The waitress was very pleasant and checked on us a few times and made sure we got everything we need.

I am a bit partial to my go-to crepe place in Matthews, but had to give this place a shot since it is within easy walking distance to my new place.  Usually when I drive by, there is a crowd waiting to be seated, so naturally I had already hyped this place up for myself.

Expecting a crowd, I was pleasantly surprised there was no wait and the place was busy, but not busting at the seams (like I had grown accustomed to seeing on my drive-bys).  It probably had something to do with the frigid cold temps that morning... but it was our gain.

The menu looked super-delicious, probably cause I had just ran 9 miles in the morning so I was ready to eat!  Had their Bacon, Egg, and waffle platter and was pretty happy with what I got.  The turkey bacon was super tasty, the eggs perfectly cooked - maybe wished for some bread to soak up the yolk... instead I used part of my waffle, and the waffle was a unique doughy texture (in a good way).

Our server was on point!  Always refilling out coffee cups and checking on us to make sure we were okay.  

I wasn't completely blown away, but I will definitely go back.  Something about the room being fairly smoky (from a previously burned food item- I am guess) and then the craziness... or lack-there-of in the kitchen.  Since it is open, I saw a lot of folks waiting for something to do.  I think what happened is that they were anticipating a usual Saturday crowd, but the weather keeping people in, gave the staff more presence in the restuarant than customers.

Amazing atmosphere, warm and inviting.  I had the Chipotle Chicken Crepe.  It was absolutely delicious.  It had the appropriate amount of seasoning and spice.  The Potato Au Gratin was AMAZING!  I ended my meal With a Chai Tea Latte, it was warm and delicious.  I will definitely return!

I love any opportunity to brunch it up, and Crispy Crepe was a slam dunk on a Saturday. We walked in around 10:30am and was seated right away, which was wonderful; we expected a crowd.
I'm a big fan of crepes and was delighted to see a large selection of both savory and sweet options. I settled on the Smoked Salmon crepe. It was delicious  and very large. It's served with a cheese potato hash( the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hash needs salt, pepper and love). The portions are large so if you're into sharing you could potentially share one crepe or get a savory crepe and a sweet crepe and split it between two people if you wanted to try more things on the menu.

Prices were reasonable for brunch and the service was great. Will definitely be back next time in Charlotte!

This amazing brunch spot has it all!

It has a wide variety of drinks to choose from. A lot of specialty coffees that will bring me back to try the next kind. I ordered a s'more latte. It was very good! It came with toasted marshmallows with graham crackers sprinkled above the coffee. My girlfriend liked it so much she basically took it from me. 

I got the chocolate peanut butter waffle. It was amazing. The waffle is made in house and is thick and full bodied. It had chocolate peanut butter treats drizzled on top of it. The only thing I regretted was getting that with the smore latte. That was a lot of sugar for me but I wanted to try both. They also have a wide variety of crepes that are not sweet but savory. I had a bit of my girlfriends crepe and it was delicious. 

The service was great. Our server was very personable and offered suggestions and suggested  us her favorite dishes. Great experience!
